comment: Not Verified |  Due to being very busy last minute I accidentally booked for the wrong airport and didn't realize until I arrived at security. I went to the front desk and Tami was able to help me switch to DCA instead of IAD. I wouldn't have had time to get there to board and my ride had left already so I was so grateful for her assistance! I was able to still get home on time, even a little early.

header: "What they did was disgraceful to their customers"
comment: Not Verified |  My wife and in-laws were flying from Austin TX to Miami Fl. The flight was delayed and left late, they had a connecting flight in Houston that Southwest said would hold. When they arrived the flight was not held. I will never spend another dime to fly Southwest again. They do not do what they say they will do. What they did was disgraceful to their customers. They should be ashamed.

Not Verified | They lost a gate checked and tagged stroller and I was mocked by the flight attendant for just wanting my stuff! Their flight crew have attitudes like adult entertainers. Unprofessional. Rude. Should’ve flown Spirit. This review would not be here if the flight attendant did not mock me for trying to find my 4 year old daughters stroller.
route: Orlando to Detroit via St. Louis

comment: Not Verified |  I have flown faithfully with Southwest for many years and I’ve never had to cancel a flight. But my boyfriend was ill and didn’t want to expose anyone to whatever he had so we choose to cancel. When we bought our tickets it said in bold print no cancellation fee. And I looked at the small print papers and they also said no cancellation fee will be incurred. When I called to cancel the first person said there is a 200.00 dollar cancellation fee. I asked to speak to a higher person and they told me I have no choice to accept fee or lose all the money. At first I accepted it . Then I read their policy over and over and again it said no cancellation fees. I called back and spoke to someone and said this is not acceptable your policy clearly states no cancellation fees. I had to fight with this person and I told them I will see them in court and call news crews. They finally gave me back my 200.00 dollars. I still have the policy and no fees incurred on my phone. I’m disappointed that they know their policy but yet try to lie and and steal money from their clients. My boyfriend is a lawyer and I’m an educated women and had to fight for my rights. How many people have paid the fee that shouldn’t have. The airline clearly are stealing from people. The public needs to be aware of these deceptive practices. I’m sure they know what they are doing. When I called it was the same person answering and using different names. Shame on him. Shame on Southwest.

Not Verified |  Southwest sucks, and their business class is a scam. You’ll pay $300 extra for no additional service, and every seat on the plane is the same. Not worth doing just buy their regular ticket. After flight cancellation, having to get rebooked on two flights instead of direct one, internet not working, and rude staff refused to offer cash refunds and will only give you a coupon to try to force you to fly with them again.

header: "have not taken the time to keep your luggage and the items inside dry"
comment: Not Verified |  I just can't understand why Southwest does not know and does not care to keep your luggage and the items inside dry during a rainy day. It has happened to me twice, unfortunately the day of the flight it has been rainy but Southwest crew have not taken the time and care to keep your luggage and the items inside dry - unbelievable. I have flown with American Airlines on a rainy day and have had no issue, my luggage and items inside have arrived dry. Also, for goodness sake change from first service to assigning seats. Southwest is already charging fees at the same rate other airlines.
Worst company ever, very unprofessional. They changed us from gate to gate 9 time , after that they cancel the flight, trying to find the flight to get home not helping and very rough people
Not Verified |  So unorganized as a whole. Delayed flights, short staffed, no drinks. Unassigned seating is so stupid and the seats are tiny. You get what you pay for.

Not Verified |  First time flying Southwest and my first time being stranded at the airport - they kept changing my flight times and then canceled it. How can you let people sit at an uncomfortable airport all night with no accommodations at all. Lied about discounts for a room no instructions on how to get to the room or back to the airport in the morning just the flight has been canceled.

Not Verified |  Terrible experience with zero communication. Passengers understand that weather is out of personal control of the staff, however there should always be a responsibility to communicate when plans must change rather than leaving everyone guessing or to their own devices trying to figure out how they can return home with no options provided. Even if the news is bad it needs to be delivered. We sat on a plane for 5 and 1/2 hours for what was supposed to be a 3 hour flight, then proceeded to land in the wrong city to wait an additional hour on the tarmac, all the while being promised that the plane would be “moving soon.” The only reason this review is not a zero is because I was eventually able to see my checked bag again which I assumed was going to be lost along with all the time I spent waiting to get to my destination.

I liked Southwest. We booked the trip during one of their low-fare specials. We didn't experience any delays or boarding issues at all. In fact, we had a total of 4 flights (to and from our destination) and we landed about 20 minutes early for all of them. Flight attendants and gate attendants were friendly. Even the staff at the bag drop was friendly. I really think you receive the "energy" you give to people. So I greeted them with a smile and they returned with great customer service. The only thing I will say is that since there aren't different boarding classes, it can be a cramped ride. Two of our flights were booked to capacity, which means there wasn't any extra space or stretching room for your arms or legs. It can be uncomfortable. Still, the inflight movies & snacks helped to ease the "cramped space" blues. I would recommend Early-bird check-in to try to get A or B-section boarding--to accommodate your carry-on and seat preference. Some of the travelers in the C section had to check their carry-on luggage at the last minute because the A & B sections used all of the overhead bins. The airlines have a lot of no-hassle policies which I like: 2 free checked bags Free movies & live TV Decent fares Free cancellation and changes I probably wouldn't use the airlines for flights over 2 hours, just because of the seating tightness. I'm 5'4" and even I found the seats a bit squished for my liking, I felt bad for my 6'0" husband's knees and back. Other than that, I'll book again for shorter routes.

Flew from WA to Houston with two toddlers. We arrived in Houston at midnight where the airline told us they had lost our luggage and we’re told to call back at 9am. I told the lady in the front our car/house keys were in that bag and we would be stuck there until our bag arrived. The lady said “ We’ll you can call them at 9am, there’s nothing we can do. I asked to speak to a Southwest Airlines manager at 3:30 10/24 and he said “ that’s why we advice you don’t leave your keys in your bags” . Extremely unhelpful! Will never be flying with Southwest again!
route: Spoken to Houston via Las Vegas

comment: I had a horrible experience flying with Southwest this trip. The flight attendant was very rude to us. Being handicap on this flight I would expect more support and help. She yelled at me when I asked her a question. Even the people around us were like you need to settle down. She also wouldn’t get me a wheel chair so my wife had to get it and push me to the baggage claim. I will never fly Southwest again.

header: "clerks at check in were so unorganized"
comment: Not Verified |  The service clerks at check in were so unorganized. They open service desk at 3:30 am, my flight leaves our board at 5:40 am. Clerks were aggressive with their tone, rude and dry towards customers. We as customers didn’t know we had to use kiosk first. To check in it would help to have someone available to assist us better. Me and my wife will not try to fly here ever.

Gate agent became very upset because she insisted I boarded in wrong group. This was not the case and even though i asked for clarification she she called a very rude supervisor who insisted that I could not stay on that flight. Had to rebook with another airline to make my business meeting on time. A very poor way to handle this, she seemed really power hungry.

Not Verified |  I used to be a big fan of SW. That was before they ruined our family vacation and treated us poorly. We were taking our grandchildren to the balloon festival in Albequerque when Southwest cancelled the second leg of our flight and dumped 6 of us in Houston at midnight without even telling us! My grandson saw his bag being pulled off the plane and the flight crew walked out, leaving 6 of us sitting on the plane!! We had to run after them and it was”-so sorry, call back tomorrow!” Yeah “good luck finding a hotel we can’t help”. Five of us were able to get out the next morning, but we missed the last balloon flight of the festival and spent the next day (Sunday) just trying to get home. Oh yeah, we got a $100 voucher per ticket ($400). The hotel we finally found at 1 am cost more than that plus the hotel night we paid for in Albuquerque that we didn’t use. We’ve bought more than 24 airline flights in the last year - not one was on Southwest. We are absolutely disgusted with Southwest and will never fly them again.
route: New Orleans to Albuquerque via Houston

comment: Not Verified |  We attempted to book a flight from BWI to Indianapolis for Sunday, October 16, 2022 and wanted to use miles. We were in the process of putting in the information to purchase the ticket and got a notice that we needed to purchase additional miles. We purchased $345 in additional miles to have enough for the ticket and then continued to enter the rest of our information for the ticket. When we clicked purchase, we got an error message and it said to call the airline. Upon speaking with a Southwest Airlines representative, we were told that the flight was now sold out. So frustrating. We then asked for our money back for the miles we could no longer use and were told that they were non-refundable. Apparently Southwest thinks it's ok to spend $345 and not even get a ticket for it. When I asked to speak with a supervisor, I was told that they would forward my "case" to Corporate Customer Relations and that we'd hear from them in 10-12 business days. We just received a call from a Customer Relations representative and all he did was explain that he wouldn't refund the money and that it was their policy. The entire process is a bait and switch and should be banned. Southwest Airlines should stop these fraudulent practices and refund customer's money when they can't give them a ticket. We plan to avoid Southwest Airlines whenever we can. Watch out.

Still waiting on our luggage. Southwest Airlines is getting on my last nerve. We were told at 4:00 that they located our luggage and once it arrived to Charlotte they would verify that it was our luggage then they would call me and let me know it was there and they would deliver it. Yes, they called and the person asked how long we were going to be here because they didn’t want to deliver it tonight. The girls attitude sucked. we never raised our voice or freaked out. We were polite to every person we spoke to. We went along with everything they said. I don’t know how they misplace every piece of luggage we checked. I could possibly understand one or even two pieces. But all 4? But to call us and give us attitude because they have to deliver it to us. They should have done their job to begin with and deliver it to us at the terminal when they were supposed to then we wouldn’t be in this situation. We are exhausted and fed up with all of it! Southwest Airlines, I’m flying without you next time around.

Southwest has given affordable flights and continues to so, I enjoy traveling with them. My complaint isn’t the flight itself, its about the boarding. I pay extra to fly business class, so that I can board early and get my pick of seats. Over the past year I’ve sat back and watched more and more people pre boarding. It is obvious that 95% of the pre boarders aren’t disabled, they have just learned the system and are abusing it. All passengers see it and recognize the problem but yet, Southwest has done nothing. My wife flies with me through my campaign pass but she never boards in the same group as I board. We apply for our boarding pass at the same time and she ends up 50 people behind me. When will Southwest fix this problem. I’ve voiced both problems to flight attendants and I’m always told that they are aware of the problem and that they get lots of complaints about it. I’m rating this 5 out of 10 because I’m always upset when boarding. Ruins a portion of the flight every time.

header: "the rudest airline staff I have ever dealt with"
comment: Decided to purchase early check in hoping for a better seat. It did not clearly explain that you still have to check in later and accept the boarding assignment the choose. When questioned they rudely said "it does not guarantee A boarding". I asked since it will not show boarding assignments until normal 24 hours prior to flight how do I know I was give an assignment at 36 hours before flight and was very rudely told that I just didn't understand how it worked but if I wanted to spend some more money I could get an earlier boarding assignment. These are the rudest airline staff I have ever dealt with.
route: San Diego to Houston via Corpus Christi

comment: couldn't fly because he had to many hours, so we were made to leave the tarmac and go back to the gate. While we waited for over an hour with no air conditioning, nothing about the passengers. Our flight arrived 2 hrs late. I was offered no food or drink the entire time we waited, nor while in the air.  What is wrong with your company and employees?

This is the worst airline service in The United States by long stretch. This airline has managed to make what should be simple, into a complicated mess with their seating program. If you have to be somewhere on time or if you have to be at an event that is time dependent, do not fly this airline. You will be late and there will be multiple delays or delays then a cancellation following right after. This airline doesn’t cancel early ever, if they cancel a flight, it’s last minute when they calculate it isn’t worth a flight. They do not care if you depended on them, this airline will bend you over with no remorse or second thoughts. This is the airline that will get you to places, but that could mean between 1-3 days after your scheduled flight because of delays and cancellations at the last minute due to not selling enough tickets, but this is how this business conducts its service. Soon enough they’ll be going out of business, and I can’t wait to see this lousy airline become a part of airline bankruptcy history. I will never fly this airline again. I would rather drive or walk to my destination. I am not impressed by this airlines performance. Their service has dropped below its competitors.

header: "I don’t want to fly with them"
comment: I have made multiple purchases for a flight and both times the money has gotten put back into my account. The first time I called them and they said it was a banking problem so I called my bank and they said it was nothing on their end, called southwest customer service again after I made my second purchase (which was $100 more then the first time I bought a ticket) and they said everything should be fine, and that the confirmation code was verified and nothing should go wrong. A couple days after wards it happened again so I just called southwest and was on hold for an entire hour just for them to tell me that I need to go to the airport and do it there, I cannot do it online or by any other card and it needs to be purchased at the airport. My flight is suppose to be in a week so there is no guarantees that seats will still be open, I have a job so I can’t go for another 3 days and my airport is almost 2 hours away from me. This is ridiculous, I’m just trying to go visit a friend in college but now I have to deal with this. I have used southwest many other times and had no problems, I thought it was reliable airline but after this, I don’t want to fly with them.

Not Verified |  LAX-RNO. I never seem to have any problems with Southwest and it's been that way for years now. Mind you flying in and out of Reno is always super easy. Check-in at LAX was a breeze as was security. We were kept informed as to the 15–20 minute delay. Both ground staff and cabin crew were just fine. The usual Southwest beverage and snack provided which is fine for a flight under an hour. Flight was quick, smooth and uneventful. Luggage arrived with no hassle and we were on our way home within 20 minutes after landing.

San Diego: Jam packed terminal, absolutely no seating for the entire day. I stood for hours. Multiple delays and two flight re-bookings from 10:55 AM until 6:10 PM in San Diego, when I finally boarded the last flight out of San Diego to Chicago trying to get to Washington DC. I was assured by the gate agent that I would make my connection from Chicago to DC. I missed it by 30 minutes. Arrived at MDW in the middle of the night. No open restaurants in the airport. Took shuttle to expensive hotel, not in my budget, to say the least. No room service. Closed for the night.  No meal vouchers, no compensation offered. Spent $175 for a 5 hour stay. Southwest claimed weather related issues, but other airlines were taking off from San Diego in the fog! Why not Southwest? The truth is, I overheard personnel (flight attendants, gate agents) discussing missing co-workers.  Saying that the delays were weather related let them off the hook for any compensations to abandoned passengers. Flight four of four: Jam packed terminal in Houston, waiting for flight to San Diego. Screaming 3 yr old, screaming 1 year old (same family) in terminal, waiting for our flight. The family (three women) held these screaming children on their laps in the terminal for an hour, never letting them down to walk or run. Then, on the airplane, they sat in the seats behind me. I was in the bulkhead seat, along-side a handicapped man. For the duration of the three hour flight, the young, inexperienced mother did nothing to quiet her children while she read a book.. She gave them no toys, did not talk to them, just let them kick the seats in front of them non-stop, squirt juice onto the head of the handicapped man, all the while letting out non-stop ear-piercing, blood-curdling screams. I have travelled with toddlers before, many times. I know it can be difficult, but this was a parenting issue. The flight attendant was just a few feet away, so could not miss what was going on. The handicapped man asked the flight attendant to intervene multiple times. Only twice, she spoke gently to the mother, who responded "They are children! What am I supposed to do?" She was completely unapologetic. The flight attendant never spoke in a firm manner with her, as she should have. I can't help but think that if the screaming kicking person were an adult, the plane would have been landed at the nearest airport and an arrest would have occurred with head -spinning speed. Why is such torture of other passengers tolerated? There was a lot that could have been done to alleviate the situation. Do children's rights trump adult's rights? One of those screaming children did not even pay for a seat, as we adults did. My seat-mate and I agreed that, even though we have both been die-hard Southwest customers for decades (I am 68, and I have been flying on you since you were a baby airline!), we said to each other that we would never again willingly fly Southwest. It has become a cattle-car with none of the humor or comeraderie that used to make it bearable to fly in seats intended to fit middle-schoolers. Bye Southwest.
route: Washington to San Diego via Houston

comment: Not Verified | On Sept 30, 2022, my Southwest flight from Sacrament to Tucson was Cancelled. The computer quickly re-routed me - but on a tedious route with 2 plane changes and long layovers. I approached SW counter staff and they quickly and graciously found a better, more efficient routing. My takeaway from this? I tried to be patient and didn't yell at them. Wonderful results.
route: Sacramento to Las Vegas via Tucson

comment: Normally Southwest is fine but their communication and timeliness was terrible this last flight. We had an hour delay and then another 45 min delay waiting for a plane that took our gate to empty and board. I guess since we were already late - let us suffer. Very little communication and super frustrating

This is the worst airline I've ever been on. I have traveled to over 35 countries so I am experienced with most of them. No seating arrangements, are you kidding? I'm not a kid on a school bus anymore! Everyone who thought that's a good idea is just plain stupid.
route: san Antonio to Greenville via Atlanta

header: "did not honor the early bird options"
comment: Santa Ana to Portland via San Jose. Our group of 3 persons paid the add on fee of Early Bird for our round trip. Our trip down went as booked. However, Sept 30 we did our online check in (22 hours ahead) and had been assigned A24-25-26 early bird boarding for both legs of our returning flights. Yesterday— Oct 1, 2022 we got to the airport to check in only to find out we had been reassigned to C group on first leg and B group on 2nd leg. At this point we still had NO IDEA our entire itinerary had been changed. I paid an additional $30 fee to upgrade to A7 boarding the other 2 in my group kept their C group. We were all confused and angry. We got down to the gate only to realize we were not even on flight 376 anymore but we were now on a flight 282 to San Jose and our SJC to PDX was also different. So we were no longer on our 4:10pm flight out of Santa Ana to San Jose. We had been moved to a 6:45pm flight because we found out our Portland connection flight had been cancelled. So because they had changed our itinerary at 9am on 10/1 we no longer had A group early bird boarding assigned. We were now stuck in C boarding which was why I had been told I had to pay another $30 upgrade fee so that I would still be in A group. The agent checking us in never even realized what had happened to us. She was very nice but her explanations to us were NOT accurate. She never even told us we were no longer on our 4:10 pm flight. As far as I’m concerned —ALL of this was horrible SW airlines service. We were never consulted on any changes or choices that were made for us. When we did our initial online check in we were in A group for our original reservation flights. When they changed us they did not give us our PrePaid early bird check ins for those new flights. In addition, in reality they should never have changed our first flight either because we could have just had an extended layover of 2 hours in San Jose but still had our pre assigned A group for that portion. I am unhappy and VERY dissatisfied. If they are moving flights they need to be sure they can still honor their own early bird boarding on the flights they are moving their customers to. I am giving them a very low rating because they did not honor the early bird options that our group of 3 had chosen when we made our original reservations and also PAID for. In addition I’m giving the ticket agent a 3 rating because while she was a very nice woman — she should have been able to figure out and tell us that all these changes had been made!! Instead I just paid another $30 for something I had already paid additional for — early check in and A group boarding.
route: Santa Ana to Portland via San Jose

comment: Not Verified |  My parents, husband, and I flew from Maui to Phoenix. My dad is in wheelchair and needs assistance. They said only one of us could accompany him, however since seats are first come first serve it would have split the four of us up. We wanted to be near my parents to help them with anything they needed. They made an exception and let us all go together. This was never an issue with any other airlines. That was really the only hiccup that we had. However Wi-Fi connection was not good for other people that paid for it. Our flight attendants were fantastic, they made the long flight fun!

Not Verified | I wanted to provide a glowing review for Josey Ventura, Southwest OPS Agent for my 9/11/22 flight from Las Vegas to San Antonio. Josey was amazing! I can't believe what a positive experience she gave my son (3 yrs) and myself. We had been in the airport all day long due to a missed flight (TSA was back-out of the literal door at the airport). Josey was so kind to us, made my son feel welcome and excited to fly, and gave us an incredible experience after a very disappointing and expensive day. She made sure to take care of us so that we were all in-order for our flight and were comfortable and ready to board. I am very grateful for her amazing service and please promote this woman. She needs to represent your company in the upper echelons. She was fantastic!

Nashville to Philadelphia. This is next to the worst airline I have ever flown. Bizarre. It’s a free for all finding a seat on the plane. No assigned seats. Just get onboard and find a seat - really? It’s low class budget. Employees obviously are not compensated well. Flight attendants are flippant and think they are comedians. They absolutely suck. I routinely fly Delta and opt for AA from time to time but was forced to fly SW due to last minute changes. Flight was delayed waiting for another SW that was late. SW screwed up so now passenger pays the price instead of SW. I cannot say enough bad things. It’s just trashy. Plane looks like it was manufactured in the 70s. No WiFi. No beverages were served because it was “going to be a turbulent flight.” Not a bump was experienced the entire flight. Pay $100 more and fly a real airline that attempts to serve the passenger.

Not Verified |  I have flown Southwest since 1980. Their on time performance is now the laughing stock of the industry. Today my outbound flight is delayed 2 hours. They are delayed well over 50% of the time. In 40 years I was never stranded by them where the delay prevented me making a connection. However, I have been stranded 3 times this year!! I have always been loyal to them, I have kept flying them with hope that they will fix the delays. However, I am now switching to Delta on my next trip. While I don’t fly near as much as earlier in my career, I have spent over $4000 this year with them. No more revenue from me!!

Not Verified |  On Southwest Flight 1403 from El Paso to Dallas Love Field, we were assisted by the Flight Attendant, Christine, who was really helpful and kind, she helped us get Wheelchair Access at Dallas. It was a tight schedule at DAL and I was worried we wouldn't make it on time, but she was reassuring and that was encouraging.
route: El Paso to Dallas Love Field

header: "paid $30 extra dollars to get priority boarding"
comment: Not Verified |  I had two carry on bags and a cross body bag (literally the size of a wallet) for easy access to my ID. The many scanning tickets literally made me step out of line to “consolidate” my cross body bag into one of my other carryon bags. I paid $30 extra dollars to get priority boarding and this clown basically made me board later (putting me in a position to get a seat farther at the back). I want my $30 back basically because it was a waste of money.

They have the absolute worst website and customer service, I tried to upgrade my flight well over 24 prior to my flight on the website and it wouldn't let me upgrade and kept saying error and to call customer so I did and they also had error and were unable to get my flight upgraded, but they ended up charging my account twice. When I called to have them cancel the charges they told me they could do nothing for me and I had to fix their mistakes myself by personally calling bank and have the charges canceled. They did absolutely nothing to rectify the situation, I will never fly Southwest again, the boarding and seating is unorganized and hectic not with the headache.

Southwest is the worst airline. In March of 2022, they sent my checked bag to a different airport. Now, 5 months later, they sent my checked bag to a different airport again. Terrible customer service: After speaking with several agents about this reoccurring issue, they assured me my bags would arrive 24 hours later. After 48 hours, multiple customer service calls, and multiple false arrival times given to me, my bags finally arrived. Every customer service agent had a different story, and none offered to compensate me for their mistake. I will never fly with this horrendous and overpriced airline again.

This airline has completely gone down the drain. Their customer service is practically non-existent, and they think it's ok to cancel multiple flights over multiple days due to "weather" ONE HOUR before the flight is to take off, and then not reimburse anything (ubers, change of flight, hotel to stay the extra night). I will be flying any other airline whenever possible. SW has become a disgrace.
Never flying Southwest again. Family saved about 3-4 rows in the back and made it hard for everyone left to find a seat on a flight they had already oversold. Very stressful experience for my group.

We flew back home from visiting our daughter in Utah and sat in row 11 in the over the wing exit row. "Heavenly" was our flight attendant and she was amazing. From what we heard, she is new to Southwest and we wanted to give her "Kudos" for her attitude, knowledge and overall deamenor she had, even with a full flight late in the evening. She was hillarious and should be noted she made dozens of people laugh and enjoy her antics while asking us if we are prepared to help out in the case of an emergency during the flight. We know all to well, reviews can be extremely negative, however, wanted to give a "shout out" and A-class service provided by Heavenly and the entire crew of flight 859 at 9:00p Gate B18 in Salt Lake City on 9/19/22. Thank you for making flying fun again.

I’ve always been an advocate for flying with Southwest, but lately I’ve been extremely disappointed with their level of service. The next Spirit Airlines! I’m an A-List preferred flyer based on how frequent I fly, and lately all of my flights have been significantly delayed. I can handle an hour or two, but 4+ hour delays with no alternative solutions is absurd. Be prepared to have back up options to get to your destination when flying with Southwest now.

My friend and I were seated a few feet away from the boarding gate since the gate was overcrowded. We were constantly paying attention to any boarding announcements or boarding status displays on the LCD. Other than a 10 min departure delay, there was no other display shown nor any announcements made. When we were close to the departure time, I reached out to the desk to inquire when the boarding would begin. Thats when the LCD showed 'boarding closed' status. There was no personnel at the desk to answer our questions, no boarding announcement made nor any paging calls placed! when we reached our adjacent gate, the associate told us the plane had boarded and was getting ready for departure and that we had missed our flight. All this when we were seated just next to the gate. I had to shell out $450 for another airline ticket to reach my final destination. I have traveled extensively for the past 15 years and have never missed a flight. In this day and age of texts, emails, paging boarding calls, displays and announcements there isn't any opportunity for missing a flight unless the airline doesn't have proper protocol in place to page checked in passengers for boarding. Southwest refused to admit it was their fault. I even showed them a pic of the gate a few min before departure, wondering what's going on with boarding. Both my friend and I could not have missed the boarding call had it been made in the first place. I am not flying Southwest again.

Not Verified |  The Customer Service Representative at Gate 25 whose name was Michelle was extremely helpful when we just barely arrived at the Gate in time for Boarding. She was quick, efficient, and personable and she got us aboard in time. I was duly impressed by her performance.

Today we had the pleasure of flying with Southwest. There was a WWII veteran on the plane with us as well that the crew members and the pilot recognized overhead where all other passengers gave a round applause. Once we landed in Wichita, the crew members once again recognized him and stated the fireman were on the sides making a rainbow salute for their appreciation for this sweet man. Yet again, all passengers once again clapped and thanked the veteran. It was one of the best, If not the best experiences I have had on any airline. Thank you Southwest for doing this!

Not Verified |  Despite a known traveler number being on file, SW consistently fails to print this on the boarding pass - which means we can not go through TSA precheck. I have now wasted over an hour first on the website confirming the number is on file (so can't enter again), on phone calls (on hold, disconnected, on hold again) and through FB messenger attempting to get this sorted out. All I get is an automated system saying someone will be with me shortly - clearly not! - and after eventually getting one response from FB messenger asking for additional information - nothing. Southwest used to be a great airline to travel with: friendly, great customer service, on time. Now, they are awful. Flights delayed or cancelled, no customer service, and the staff cranky - likely because they are overworked and perhaps treated as badly as customers now are

Typical Southwest first excuse for delay was weather, next excuse was air traffic control but all flights at the other gates are departing. They first said 10 minutes delay now an hour. The flight is not full approximately 100 empty seats so they are probably screwing all of us. The 10:00 pm flight which is 4 hours and 10 minutes later

Not Verified |  2nd time flying with Southwest this year (2022) and both times have been severely disappointed. Between flight cancellations and getting stranded to baggage getting lost and having no answers from the Southwest attendants, by far the worst travel experience through this airline. I usually travel a lot for work and use United which has been great.

header: "decided not to fly with southwest again"
comment: If you want to get upset, travel with southwest. It is my third flight and the last, with southwest, on the previous trip my bags arrived late but they arrived the same day although late. We gave another vote of confidence to this airline, and it was fatal. Again my bags arrived late but this time the next day, the southwest staff in Fort Lauderdale was very rude, the staff treated all passengers on flight 3920 Fort Lauderdale - Havana as if we had not paid for a decent service. Many passengers came from connections in different cities and even so the Southwest staff forced almost all passengers to pay 75 dollars for the carry on bag, due to this the plane was delayed almost 40 minutes. I felt so bad that I decided not to fly with southwest again.

I bought a round trip ticket on Southwest. I was told that bringing my golf clubs in a case would not be a problem. I arrived in Greenville, but my luggage didn't. I had to fill out paperwork and instructions, then go to my destination without any of my needed possessions, including medications. My bags finally arrived and the following day I unpacked my golf carrier, only to discover that Southwest had broken the shaft on my $500 driver. I had to borrow a driver to play the round and cancel other rounds because I couldn't use the same one. I reported the broken driver to Southwest only to be told that they didn't cover the clubs or bag for any loss. I went back and looked at the baggage section on the website and there was no mention of that in the basic policies. Only when digging much deeper was there any information regarding that kind of loss. So in addition to being treated like cattle, squeezed into tiny seats with no legroom, forced to endure 3 plane changes and 4 layovers, I'm out $500 for my favorite driver. I will never use this unprofessional subpar airline again.

Las Vegas to Long Beach. Southwest Airlines employees used to be so friendly and helpful. I guess those days are gone. I was willing to put up with the cattle call seating, delays, and stale pretzels because the treatment was pretty great. The last flight I took began in Long Beach and ended in Las Vegas. I needed additional assistance getting my ticket changed and stood in line for over an hour. Some "diva" manager was leaving and left the passengers in the hands of an elderly woman who was clearly new on the job. The diva offered no assistance but flitted in and out of the ticket area while the newbie floundered. Yesterday, I checked on two flights and saw that the return flights on both were not there. In a panic, I quickly made the additional flights. In reviewing my credit card, I saw that I had actually made the round-trip flights. So, I called "customer service. The CSR who was supposed to be helpful was rude and clearly did not want to take my call. She huffed and tapped her pen and kept saying okay, okay I got it even when I was talking. Then, she proceeded to put in the flights but I still was overcharged. I saw online that my original flights (2) had been canceled and she told me that when a passenger gets new flights their previous ones are canceled.

Not Verified |  We left our home at 2:00 am and arrived at the airport at 4:00 for a 6:00 flight. We checked in and checked our luggage, went through security and approximately 5:15 we were headed for our gate. At 5:22 we received message that our flight had been Modified. Our flight was now at 11:10 and we were not reaching Salt Lake until after 9:00 pm. They said there was nothing they can do! We lost our first day and car rental and would not reach out destination until approximately 2:30 am. This has us up for over 24 hours. Will never use Southwest again.

I paid extra for my friend and I to sit together. It was an extra $40 for both of us to get seats together. As we boarded the plane people said first come first serve on seats. My friend and I were getting anxious because we feared we were not going to sit next to each other. As it turned out we paid extra and did not sit with each other. We are both very upset about our negative experience and would never fly Southwest again unless our situation can be corrected.

header: "I will never fly with them again"
comment: Not Verified |  Our flight got delayed from Chicago to Boston, we were supposed to get hotel because our flight but we didn’t get one - they supposedly said they was sold out, they told us that we can sleep on chairs with our kids in the airport. They were so disrespectful and me and my family had to wait in till late at night to get on a plan we all had to take different flights. I can’t believe this happen to us. I will never fly with them again and I don’t recommend it to anyone.

header: "What a mess this airline has become"
comment: Not Verified |  I would never fly Southwest again. I understand delays happen, but I am very confident that flights are being cancelled because they are not full enough. I was on the last flight out so it was full. After a 2-1/2 hour delay we boarded the plane. The boarding process is stupid to begin with. They may as well put a numbered tag in our ear and then whack us with a cattle prod when it is our turn. Once on board the plane was stiflingly hot. The seats, which should be called something else because they are not real seats, not for humans any way. Crammed together so tightly that if we were being led to slaughter it would almost be a relief. No Wi-Fi available, you could not hear the pilot when he spoke. If it could be done poorly, it was. The staff was rude, and seemed like they would prefer to be any where but there. What a mess this airline has become. I started flying Southwest back in the 90's and they were fun and hip, and on the ball. Now they are a flying disaster. Never again.

Not Verified |  Compliments to Houston Hobby gate staff and especially Miami gate staff for helping us with a disabled grandchild in a wheelchair. I explained to them it would help all if we could go down 3-5 min prior to boarding to load this 11 year old quadriplegic and then fold up her electric portable wheelchair for the gate handlers

header: "cancelled our flight because of bad weather"
comment: What a disaster! 8 hours before our flight back to work Southwest cancelled our flight because of bad weather. They auto rebooked us two days later. In what universe is that reasonable option? Spent hours on the phone trying to get our tickets refunded since flight was cancelled. Still working on that. Fortunately United was more professional. While their flights were delayed some, they were able to get us home.

The staff were super polite. Ricardo Zambria was especially was very friendly. When he found out it was as my first flight with Southwest he wrote me a certificate welcoming me to the southwest family and took a selfie with me. 10/10 customer service. I will definitely be flying with them again!

Worst flight I have ever been on. Southwest Airlines are really making it not pleasant to fly, seats are on top of each other, packed to the brim. No one is happy! I will never fly Southwest again. It seems completely irresponsible to me that an airline does not have a policy for overweight. I have the worst experience in a recent trip to Boston. I am not against obese people, just seems irresponsible that if you know how uncomfortable I was, the response is sorry ma’am there is nothing it can be done. I was next to the window. This person took the middle seat. He was taking my personal space because of the size. Whenever he needs to move, he was pushing my body against the window. At some point my right side was completely numb and my back was in pain. If I need to move, I was unable because I did not have enough space to move my legs nor my body. Several times I have had to push him to the side, but again, he barely fits in the seat. I was completely uncomfortable with him pushing and touching of this person. It was horrible! Southwest Airlines must allow that if someone is overweight, then allow this person to have the seat next to him/her empty. That way we are all happy and comfortable. I know he was uncomfortable too, but please be considerate with your passengers.

header: "All I ask for is better training"
comment: Southwest lost my bag. I am not upset they lost my bag - as stuff happens. I am upset with the follow up and follow thru of Southwest staff to return my bag to me. And how the Southwest agent misinformed me on the policy for purchases and reimbursement. Your agent told me “get whatever you need and we will be able to cut a check for you for pickup, after receipts are provided.” Yep - that is not the Southwest protocol. I asked manager at the DesMoines terminal to train and educate her staff so other passengers aren’t misinformed down the line. She did not respond. We traveled to Iowa for a wedding, my bag had my clothes as well as clothes for my 2 year old daughters (who was a flower girl in the wedding). Upon arrival with no bag, the nice gal at the Southwest counter said it will be here late tonight, and to call before coming in case the flight was delayed. I called at 4am the following morning (as that’s when she said was the next opening of the office) and my bag hadn’t moved from my original departure location. I called 4 more times that day, to be told different stories each time about how they would get my back to DesMoines, or that is was just sitting and they couldn’t tell what was going on until the bag was scanned in again. It almost seemed like once the bag is lost, there isn’t really a person who ensures it gets back on a flight to the final destination. The agents could only tell me where it was sitting. No bag delivered Saturday night. Bag finally delivered Sunday morning. Upon arrival, the nice gal at the counter gave me my bag and told my to come by after 1pm and they will have a check ready. She even scanned in my receipts. Came by after 1pm and she explained to me that I had to email the Southwest Manager at the DesMoines airport for details on how to submit the claim.  I just spend the better part of $800 and now you explain to me that I have to submit a claim and wait 30-45 days. I would not be upset if she informed me of the correct process on the front end. All I ask for is better training. Southwest - you can do it!

Not Verified |  Stewards were horrible. They literally threw the nuts at us, were not happy to take our trash away. Never a smile or friendly face. It sure seemed like they did not want to be there. When we boarded there was a nice gentleman that did greet us. Worst flight I have ever been on. Airlines are really making it not pleasant to fly, seats are on top of each other, packed to the brim. No one is happy! I will never fly Southwest again.

My grandson and I were supposed to leave Juan Santamaria Airport in San Jose, Costa Rica en route to Baltimore at 1:05 p.m. on Saturday, August 13. The flight had six delays and did not depart until after 7:00 p.m. The passengers were told that the scheduled pilot had flown too many hours within some specified time, and was over FAA regulations. Another pilot needed to be found. In addition, they said there were "some problems in Baltimore" without specifying what. I will note there are a lot of problems in Baltimore. It seems completely irresponsible to me that an airline would not keep track of pilot hours flown in order to avoid putting their customer through the situation we experienced. Before we boarded we were informed that our flight would not be non-stop, which is what we paid for. The reason given was that be the time we reached Baltimore the customs agents would have quit work for the day. We were rerouted through Houston, which added another two hours to our total flying time. When we arrived in Houston we had to drag our carry-ons out of the plane at 11:00 p.m. to have them clear customs--over three hours after we were to have landed in Baltimore--then lug them back onto the plane. Our flight finally touched down in Baltimore around 4:00 a.m., over eight hours later than the scheduled 7:45 p.m. arrival of the previous day. At least my grandson and I could go home. Many travelers were transferring in Baltimore to other destinations. For them, the agony of the day only continued. I will add that our check-in to go to Costa Rica on Saturday, August 6 did not go well either. The line at the international check-in was over one-eighth of a mile long! I have photos to prove it. Southwest did not have sufficient agents to accommodate the customers on the international flights they had booked. They were grossly understaffed. It was only through the intercession of an agent that my grandson and I were able to make our departing flight. Southwest offered the passengers on our returning flight a $200 coupon good for another Southwest flight within the next year. Big deal! We paid $1,000 round trip, $500 each way. If they really wanted to make amends they would have had a rebate commensurate with the frustration they heaped upon their customers. When Southwest arrived on the national scene years ago as a regional airline which was expanding I was very impressed. They can blame their current problems encountered by me, my grandson, and all the other customers on COVID, not enough employees, supply-chain issues, or whatever other excuses are in vogue these days. It is clear to me that this company has devolved to a significant degree. They have lost the customer-orientation they once had. Not being able to add the hours a pilot flies, and not being able to compute how many check-in people are needed for the departing flights are issues of poor management. Very poor! I will be looking for other carriers for my future trips to Costa Rica, and suggest to all who read this not to fly Southwest until such time that they give evidence of better management ... like being able to add and divide.
route: Juan Santamaria to Baltimore-Washington via Houston

comment: My brother and I were flying into Denver (round trip) and were going to take a second flight into Colorado Springs. We were supposed to meet up with our two sisters who were also taking flights into Denver, but not the Springs. When we were getting ready to board our flight to the Springs, we realized it was more efficient to meet up with our sisters at the Denver airport, so we went up to customer service to explain what we wanted to do. The lady at the desk told us that if we didn’t take our flight to Colorado Springs, we would forfeit our return flight. so we said “oh never mind, we will take our flight to Colorado Springs, we don’t want to forfeit the return flight.” but the lady insisted she would help us and cancel the in between flight, and assured us that we would be able to return home. no problem. now, we came to the Springs for our return flight and my itinerary did not come up, while so my brother was able to check in no problem. the lady at the front desk told me that i had forfeited my flight when i came into Denver, even though the woman who we talked to in Denver about it said she was taking care of us. I had to purchase my ticket again for the return flight while my brother had no problem with his return flight.
route: Denver to Colorado Springs via Baltimore

comment: We arrive early to find out the 8:55pm flight is delayed nearly hours. I have my pregnant wife and 2 year old daughter sitting at the airport at 11pm only to find out the plane we are waiting for hasn't left Los Angeles yet and to expect more delays. I know it's not profitable but warm up another plane, wake up a local crew and get these people moving. You should see this terminal right now ... people are frustrated and look defeated.

header: "no moral or respect for their customers"
comment: Got notified at 10am by email an hour before the flight leaves stating that flight will be canceled and I was rebooked for 3pm flight. My flight was supposed to land at 6pm in Dallas, now if I take the flight at 3pm I won't land til 12am. I have a 10 year old and he has school the next morning. Southwest has no moral or respect for their customers. They want us to arrive early and be prepared but they don't. They can over book flights and canceled them with no repercussions but when we do something such as canceling our flights they won't refund us back our money.

header: "flight has now been delayed by 4 hours"
comment: I arrived 2 hours early for my flight home for my mother in laws memorial service only to be told that my flight has now been delayed by 4 hours so now I'm sitting at the airport from a flight that was supposed to leave at 8:15 AM now not leaving until 12:10 PM. I'm sitting at the airport for 6 hours only to be told that my flight was delayed due to a mechanical issue then I was told that it was due to Weather. I don't appreciate being lied to. I was offered a raggedy $200 love voucher which did nothing for me With my flight being delayed by 4 hours. I missed the service in addition to having to change my rental car pick up time. My return flight home with my partner was delayed again again only to be told that that it was weather but we were pushed back for over an hour and a 1/2. I called Southwest spoke to a representative who told me that corporate would be calling me gave me a confirmation number but I have yet to hear from anyone about about this issue.

Not Verified |  Fantastic service and friendliness - above average experience. Singing on the microphone, making jokes to ease nervous passengers, no sarcasm just positive humor, just world class service! snacks are sub par but i brought some of my own!

header: "canceled our flight with very short notice"
comment: Not Verified |  I appreciate almost everything about Southwest Airlines: their friendly staff members, their free check bags, and even their customer service agents. But what really brings my review in today is a frustration that really ruined the experience altogether. After an anticipated flight home they texted to report that they had canceled our flight, with very short notice. They then rebooked us for another flight with 7+ hrs of airtime. Traveling with an infant makes that possibility near disaster. When I tried to call and rebook (the customer service gal was very courteous, but there wasn’t much she could do) every other flight was significantly longer in airtime or wasn’t until weeks out (since all the more direct flights had been sold out probably months ago). I would like Southwest to consider how this effects the people of whom they claim to care for. The short notice on cancelation left us no choice but to bite the bullet and pay a more expensive ticket on another airline (since its booking a day before) or waste time that could have been spent with the family we were hoping to see and take the longer more miserable travel route. I’m not sure on the reason for the cancelation but a promise/commitment to provide a service should mean something, especially when you pay for it! It would be nice if they would follow through. Regardless of the fact that they may lose a little money by flying a plane that doesn’t get sold out. If the cancelation was for other reasons not related to business or money, I may understand. If that is the case this review can be disregarded.

header: "You can't treat human beings like this"
comment: Not Verified |  Southwest flight 4790 just packed us all on this plane like sardines and then missed their departure window because there was too many people to board. Now we are all sitting here stuck on a plane that can not be wheels up for over an hour. We were told not to leave the aircraft but that the doors would be left open only for legal purposes. It's hot as heck and super stuffy in here. No water has be offered. This feels wrong. You can't treat human beings like this.

This was the worst flying experience I have ever had. They were short staffed with pilots so they cancelled the Austin leg of our flight because of the time constraints we were forced to spend 24 hours at the airport and after three failed attempts to put on standby flights and showing no empathy I finally got on a flight to Vegas with my wife and two kids one of them 6 years old. He is emotionally scared now from the frustration, also when we arrived in Vegas they switched our baggage claim 3 times.
route: Florida to Las Vegas via Denver

comment: We arrived at 9.15am for a flight that was to be boarding at 10. When we arrived the flight was delayed to 10.50am due to unknown reason. Once we had arrived to Baltimore we had a 4 hour layover which had turned into a 3 hour layover because of our delay at the previous airport. Southwest also makes you board in assigned numbers, but doesn’t give you assigned seats so every man/woman for themselves. They then delayed that flight back another 2 hours due to weather which had not even arrived in the area yet. When we had finally boarded the plane we began again to wait while the 3 flight attendants made jokes and conversed when they should’ve been making sure we are ready for take-off. They then introduced a new flight attendant and rode around the runway for no reason which takes more time away from our travel. After that we waited again as they delayed the flight for weather purposes. While we were delayed while sitting in the plane they attempted to try and take us back to the airport to let us off the plane and we were told they couldn’t because the boarding terminal wasn’t set up so we’ve been sitting in the plane and the airport for hours. Weather has been great all day until 5-6 pm, I’m so confused on how we have not arrived to our destination but yet my arrival time says 5pm and yet it’s 6.30pm and I still have yet to leave the airport! Ridiculous service.

header: "This airline needs to stop lying to their customers"
comment: There were several delays. My flight was scheduled to leave at 10.25 pm then 11.00 pm, a few more delays and then cancelled around midnight. No vouchers were offered. I had to find my own hotel and was rebooked on a flight the next day at 10.25 pm. Now I’m sitting at the Phoenix airport and and after a few more delays I just received a text stating the flight is again delayed until 12.37 am. Worst customer service ever. One of the customer service reps told me the one hour delay was because they were holding the flight for a few passengers. An hour delay for a few passengers? Not likely. Last night we were told they were waiting on a crew member. Today they told me yesterday‘s flight was cancelled because of weather. This airline needs to stop lying to their customers. The also don’t have an agreement with other airlines so they won’t get anyone a flight with another carrier. Don’t use Southwest if you need to be anywhere important.

Southwest is the worst airline I have seen lately my 7:00 pm flight is now delayed till 11:45 pm. I took a walk down the concourse every single gate 22 of them are delayed by at least 1:5 hours. The gate agent trying to tell me it’s the weather so apparently bad weather compassing the entire US for about 4 hours.

The second leg of my daughter's return flight to MSP was cancelled. SW could only offer a replacement flight the next day. She would have to spend a night in Baltimore rather than flying on to Minneapolis as scheduled. The SW agent directed her to work it out with another airline, but a Delta supervisor explained that Southwest doesn't participate in a reciprocal arrangement with any other airline. My daughter was forced to buy a Delta ticket at double the cost of the original Southwest flight in order to get home the same day. I meanwhile ran back to the SW counter to get a refund. Supposedly SW will refund the cost of the cancelled flight (half the replacement cost) but I haven’t seen that yet. Desired outcome (optional) For all the inconvenience, stress, and extra cost, SW, at minimum, needs to make reimbursement of the full cost of the replacement flight

Atlanta to Dallas. My sister and I were returning to Dallas. There had been some delays or flight changes. We checked in separately. When the staff discovered what was going on with our flight, YALL, he RAN to get my sister’s bag from the console so he could place us on the same flight (avoiding the delay). He was so kind and didn’t have to do that. I have NEVER had a rep RUN to assist me, that’s called customer service. Later, a pleasant young lady educated me on the Clear check in as an option to have for quicker future travel. I love Southwest!

Our flight was delayed about 3 hours and we didn’t leave Orlando until after 1am… not the end of the world but there were no representatives giving us any updates on the status of our flight but just a gate monitor showing our flight getting more and more delayed which was kind of frustrating. It would have been nice to see better communication from Southwest employees so I knew why the plane was delayed and if I should expect it to be cancelled or not. At one point during my long wait at the gate, they started boarding another flight that wasn’t supposed to leave until 2 hours after ours so that was frustrating as well. I just felt like my flight was forgotten about until 1am. On the bright side, I got into the A boarding group without paying extra for reserved check-in despite it being a full flight. The crew was very nice, the seats were fairly comfortable, and I got a variety of free snacks as well as a free drink. Entertainment was available on the Southwest app and WiFi was available for purchase. If it weren’t for the lack of communication and delay, I would give Southwest 10/10. I would recommend them as long as you book a flight that isn’t at night because it will most likely get delayed due to summer thunderstorms or staffing shortages and you may not get home until the following day.

Not Verified | Atlanta to La Guardia. On Monday, July 25th, 2022, my daughter and I were returning home from Atlanta to NYC (LaGuardia) via Southwest Airlines. First time ever using them. We arrive at the airport at 4AM for a 6:10AM flight. After going through TSA and sitting at the gate for a while, our flight was cancelled with no announcement or warning. My daughter happened to look up and see on the gate TV screen the words “CANCELLED”. The gate personnel were gone and I was left to 1) calm my daughter’s nerves because she has never experienced this before 2) calm my own nerves as I suffered from severe anxiety and my meds were in my checked bag and 3) try to figure out what to do next. Keep in mind, I booked the early morning flight because I had to be home by 9:30am to take over the babysitting duties of my two other children so that my wife could go to work. So that was my first thing to address, finding last minute child care. I then get an email confirming that my flight was indeed cancelled (no explanation as to why) and I was put on the 8:25 PM plane to LGA later that night. So now the next steps were to find out what happened to our checked bags and what to do for 14 hours till my flight with pretty much no money left for my daughter and I to find a hotel (I mean we’re taking a low budget airline. I’m a stay-at-home dad living on my wife’s income. Go figure). 14 hours later with our bags in NY before we are even on a plane, we get to the departing gate for our rescheduled 8:25pm flight and of course it’s DELAYED. 9:10pm is the new departure time. Then it’s pushed back to 10PM!!! Once on the plane, only water and a snack was offered to us (soda, coffee and alcohol were no longer an option). Once at LaGuardia, we then had to find our checked bags. My pre-arranged airport pick-up, no longer available. The line for a taxi, extremely long. My daughter and I jumped on a city bus to take us to Manhattan so that we could take a taxi to the Bronx. $30 dollars I couldn’t afford to spend charged to my credit card. Long story short, got to the airport at 4AM and after an anxiety inducing day/afternoon, my daughter and I get home at 2am in the morning. Fast forward to today. I call Southwest customer service to 1) get an explanation and 2) find out how Southwest can make things right for me so that I can continue using them in the future (again, this was my first ever experience with them). The agent informed me that the first flight was canceled due to weather and that the rescheduled flight was delayed due to air traffic control issues, so we were not entitled to compensation. 1) I never once said on the call I wanted to be compensated so that was quite an assumption and 2) was then told after reiterating everything I went through “would you have preferred that we put you on an unsafe flight?” I mean WOW!!!!! What a “great” condescending customer service response. To the Southwest rep that hopefully reads this (and yes, I will be posting this on MULTIPLE review sites and social media), I shall NEVER fly Southwest again and will voice my displeasure to anyone who asks me about my experience with Southwest. PS- My family and I had an issue with JetBlue a few years ago and their customer service was the TOTAL OPPOSITE of what I experienced with Southwest. Very warm, helpful and their actions showed that I was a valued customer.

header: "never travel with this horrible airline again"
comment: Second flight couldn't be bothered to wait 10 minutes due to my plane having mechanical issues. Got stranded in Denver for the night. They wouldn't let me get my bag even though I had my cat with me. Lost my bag and sent it to Las Vegas. All I got was $400 in travel vouchers which are worthless to me since I would never travel with this horrible airline again. I was told lie after lie about what needs to be done and was given the runaround for hours.

Not Verified |  Good prices and nice perk with the free checked bag. I’ve flown Southwest multiple times solely because of price and you get what you pay for. I never had a flight from Southwest on schedule. Always a delay or changing gates last minute. Seats are uncomfortable and most of the time the staff is rude. One time they “couldn’t find the pilot” and delayed us for three hours. I recommend spending the extra money and flying with another airline. Southwest is very unprofessional

header: "allow active duty members to board with class"
comment: I am a military active duty member. All other airlines allow active duty members to board with class A or first. I was not able to board the flight until everyone from class A boarded first.

header: "left us stranded in Amarillo for 2 days"
comment: Southwest left us stranded in Amarillo for 2 days. We finally had to buy United Airline tickets $1,200 to get back home. Southwest offered us $175 refund Southwest is so disappointing. Don’t let their prices fool you. You get what you pay for. Totally unreliable

Not Verified |  Bad deceptive customer service. Used a travel fund of $20 from a previous flight against a new flight. Paid an additional $150. One day later got covid and had to cancel. But the entire $170 credit now has an expiration date of just a few days - because the old original $20 travel fund would have expired in just a few days. That's not right. The $150 I just paid should have a new expiration date, and not be stuck with the old. Called customer service. She wouldn't budge. It's my problem, I suppose. Shame on you Southwest.

Not Verified |  Tried to get a nonstop, cancelled that months ago. Cancelled my connecting flight while I was in the air, rerouted with another connection. Every flight delayed due to weather or crew availability. Left home at 7am arrived destination 1am for what should have been a 2.5 hour flight. Lost the bags, took another 24 hours to get bags from when they went missing. We really appreciated the tag on the bag saying sorry for the inconvenience. I work hard for a living, 5 day vacation, Southwest stole 2 days of them. if you are understaffed don't continue to book flights. I will understand that and drive next time.

Chicago to Orlando. I booked a flight for my family of 9 to depart on June 29 at 9am and when we get to the airport awaiting to be boarded, they announced the flight is canceled at 8:30am. A few minutes later, they arranged the passengers to either call or wait in line to the customer counter to have flight rearrange. The reason that was given the flight was cancelled is that weather in Orlando is bad enough for they now allowing flights to come in (which is a super stupid and big lie). And it was just that I searched the internet to see that over 1000 of their pilots are picketing and I believe this is the true reason and they just not willing to admit that and unwilling to cut low on their flights to accommodate this. Instead, my flight is delayed for almost 12 hrs and my family of 9 had to split up with 3 flying to transfer in Ohio. We ended up to arrive in Orlando at 1 in the morning instead of 1 in the afternoon. And I see that a flight on the same day departing at 10 am did not have a delay or cancellation. This is the first time I fly in Southwest and probably the last time. I accept delay but I do not accept giving unbelievable excuses due to the company’s poor management and their attitude to just want to make money and carelessness for people whatsoever.

Not Verified |  Horrible customer service. Looked online last night having to go out of town for celebration of life for my father-in-law. Flight is $1200 for myself, husband, and 2 year old. Called to see if we could get discount for bereavement. Was transfered over to the manager, he quoted me that it was going to be over $2000. I asked why so much as it's still showing $1200 online. Said that's what he's able to give. I asked to speak to a manager about getting discount. Said he was the manager, asked to speak to his manager. Said he was the only manager.  Then told to just buy it online and then have a nice day. Then he hung up on me. Never, have I ever spoke to someone so arrogant and rude.

Not Verified |  Southwest post COVID is a complete disappointment. They were known for customer service and were the last to come to the party with positive customer service and drink service after the pandemic. It is clear that morale among flight attendants is low - not sure if that is due to corporate support or employee entitlement after COVID. I have switched to Delta and United for all business travel and now fly SW only for price necessity. I was a very loyal customer for years and now feel no loyalty at all. Prices are not worth it. Late flights, SW waits too long for delayed passengers - how does it make sense to hold up 200 (ish) passengers for 5 people? I have been on both sides and would have understood if flight had to leave. Today we waited 45 minutes for 5 passengers, all of whom boarded in the first 30 minutes. Why the extra 15 min? Previously delightful attendants now act put out and entitled. Prices aren’t as competitive as they were historically. What a shame - used to be such a great company.

header: "the customer service at Southwest has dramatically declined"
comment: Not Verified |  Unfortunately, a friend was not able to make a flight that I had purchased for them. Since I was in the middle of a flight myself, I could not cancel the flight. Southwest enacted their no show policy. Therefore, no refund could be given for the initial missed fight nor the return trip. The overall cost was +$600. I can understand penalizing me for the initial flight, but to take the funds for the return flight is downright criminal. I was given a travel voucher for only $150. I have noticed that in the past few months that the customer service at Southwest has dramatically declined. I have tried to contact them several times concerning this issue. I only receive a generic reply email stating the no-show policy and a half-hearted sorry. I would say that if you plan flying with them to at least check other options.

header: "you just lost a life long traveler"
comment: I’m currently sitting in the Houston Hobby airport fighting back tears of anger and frustration. Southwest should be ashamed of themselves but they are not. We landed from Harlingen at 9:04pm getting alerts that our flight home to St. Louis was delayed the minute airplane mode went off. Currently our flight home is a play pretend flight; as of this very moment the departure is scheduled for 2:19am and originally that departure was 9:55pm. We have no real scheduled flight home because the departure time is constantly being moved, the excuse is MCO weather bc that is the connecting flight however the gate next to ours is on time and flying into MCO, Southwest has no responsibility in the matter or to make anything right bc it’s “the weather’s fault”? I’m so disappointed. I exclusively fly Southwest. Say nice things (until now). Encourage and book trips that make y’all a lot of money. Even had one booked for 2 weeks from now that thanks to your lack of accountability I have plenty of time to cancel sitting in your airport waiting for my play pretend flight. The icing on the cake? Myself and my travel partner were offered a flight out in the morning if we chose to pay for our own accommodations due to the lack of accountability or give a damn by Southwest.  Get your life together Southwest, you just lost a life long traveler on your airline but based on how you do things you obviously don’t care in the least.
route: Harlingen to Saint Louis via Houston

comment: Not Verified |  3 hours before my flight they canceled it and booked it 15 hours later. I was forced to use another PTO day of work so now I’m down a PTO day because of them. I would rather walk from Boston to Denver than fly with them again. The last two times I flew with them, they put my luggage on the wrong flight and they delay every flight.

Out of the three different airlines I’ve flown with in the past couple of months, Southwest is by far the best. I’m not sure I would have thought that pre-pandemic, but they seem to have weathered the storm a little better than the others. The plane was cleaner, the attendants were nice and relaxed and the service was also superior to what I experienced with the others.

Not Verified |  Constantly reschedules your flights, doesn't go anywhere direct and every flight is delayed. They pack planes way too full with no room and are always running late. Switching to a different airline after all the horrible experiences I've had.

header: "am spending hundreds of extra dollars to never fly with Southwest again"
comment: I am tall to the point where I need special accommodation for seats, because of this I was a little worried when my family bought seats with Southwest, as they don't have a business class. Fortunately (I thought) a nice lady at the gate upgraded me to pre board. I had bought early boarding before and I thought this was an upgrade. Unfortunately the front row seats had gotten taken by the elderly and children, so I went back to exit row seats. With pre board you are not allowed to sit in the exit row though. While I appreciate the gate lady that "upgraded" me the flight attendants were rude about it and people that should have boarded after me anyways got the seats with enough leg room while my knees got embossed with the arm rests of the seats in front of me. I have canceled my return tickets and am spending hundreds of extra dollars to never fly with Southwest again.

header: "nothing but issues from the beginning to the end"
comment: Horrible, terrible, poor customer service. Unaccountability, inconsiderate, nothing but issues from the beginning to the end and more. They made me miss my flight, re-booked me, sent my luggage to the wrong location and charged me to get my luggage delivered.

Not Verified |  Plane was to depart at 4:00 PM. Flight was delayed then cancelled. Agents would not assist with rebooking, hotel accommodations, or anything else. Five adults and two children were left to fend for themselves. After talking with another agent a flight was found with seats at an airport over 30 miles away. Southwest did book us on the flight but offered no assistance in securing ground transportation. We had to use Uber (2) which we paid ourselves. We paid Southwest for priority seating and got boarding numbers B-20, and B-21. These numbers were not sufficient to be worth the extra charge. If Southwest can't promise boarding in A group they should not charge.

Not Verified |  In November of 2021, I flew Southwest Airlines to visit my family in Oklahoma City. Purchased EarlyBird check-in and had an A46 boarding position. We had a layover in Phoenix after flying in from San Diego, and our flight to OKC got delayed by about 2 hours, with our original 7 PM departure time being delayed to 9 PM. Talked to the gate agent and she said the delay was caused by our aircraft being delayed in Baltimore. Our aircraft had SWA's older Evolve cabin. I got about an hour of sleep before arriving in OKC. On the return trip, we flew to Denver where our plane had the newer Heart interior. The plane to San Diego had the Evolve cabin again. There was no delay, and we ended up getting back home to San Diego safely. Honestly, I like Southwest for their low fares and open seating.
route: San Diego to Oklahoma City via Phoenix

comment: Changed gates, delays, took 3 hours sitting on the plane. The only thing they told us that they were waiting on paperwork. I suggest flying on another airline. Even Frontier treats its customers better.

Not Verified |  I flew my son home with Southwest from college for spring break. During the stay we were notified that his flight had been cancelled. I immediately emailed and called and actually since we could not find a return flight under 1000 on a one day notice , I waited on hold 7 hours (I can prove this). Not only did no one answer, no one has answered my numerous emails. Since that time I canceled my Southwest cc and refuse to ever endorse or recommend them I am reaching out to see what sort of legal recourse I have.

What a scam airline. Everyone should know this scam they are pulling while bragging about no bag fees. This is there only selling point. They know they would lose 50% of their customers overnight if they started bag fees. There check in procedure is set up to make you want to use your points to upgrade. I was waiting to check in with my laptop and phone through there own app. Conveniently enough, when 24 hour check time came up, the website and app took 3 minutes to come up with the check in button. By the time it did and I was able to hit check in, I was given end of B group. I immediately called southwest to find out what was wrong with there system. The lady said nothing was wrong, BUT, we can upgrade you for 25,000 points to put you in A 1-15. I jumped on it because I want to use my points up and will never fly southwest again. Will cancel my credit card that I have had since 04 and spend extra money for peace of mind travel, not games. Very unprofessional business practices.
route: Los Angeles to Portland via Oakland

comment: Not Verified |  Paid for Early Bird Check-in and was still B34 (94 people plus families with kids ahead of me). Was told by agent it doesn't guarantee a better boarding number and that it was better than having a C boarding. My husband was only a couple of numbers behind me and we didn't pay for Early Bird for him. Wondering what I'm actually paying for if not a better place in line so I could get an isle seat. The flight was totally full so I got stuck in the middle. Only one of 3 flight attendants was friendly. Not a great flight!!

I paid for earlier bird special 80 bucks to get a boarding number of B 38 great value. Flight was canceled had to leave 4 hours later. I talked with an agent at the counter only to catch attitude. Personally I’m only flying Southwest because the were the cheapest. Like the old saying goes you get what you pay for. PS I was suppose to get a call back in 15 minutes, it’s been over a day now and still no call.

My children were set to fly today with their grandparents for a nice trip to Florida, as school and daycare are not covered this week, it seemed like a win win, until Southwest got involved. I took them to the airport and Southwest cancelled last minute with no flights leaving to the destination for 3 days. Somehow though, the checked bags are all flying to the original destination but with no passengers, so what is going on? We asked and they cant answer.
