Southwest claims weather and therefore wont refund the ticket price but yet the bags are flying there right now? So what is going? But they claim weather and wont discuss refunds or credits. You ruined their vacation, screwed us on daycare this week and there is important medication on those bags not to mention my kids clothes but we wont get them back for three day plus according to Southwest. Unbelievable. I used to fly west Southwest for all of my work travel but I will never fly Southwest again for business or pleasure. Get your act together Southwest, this is completely unacceptable.

Sarasota to Denver. Flew on 061922 with two children from Denver to Sarasota, with a layover in Indianapolis. Flew back on the 25th with a layover in Dallas. On the way there I got a text message from Southwest that my flight had been delayed by hours. Luckily I was in the airport when I got the message and could determine the flight had been delayed, but by less than an hour. Gate attendants were unable to explain the reason for the incorrect message. Flying back, I got another text before leaving for the airport that the flight was delayed by hours. I checked the website and found this was another incorrect message from Southwest and the delay was again less than an hour. I found other customer reviews indicating many others had received similar text messages from Southwest and the inconvenience and expense for some had been significant. There were enough reviews that Southwest had to be aware of the problem for some time and had not fixed it. I’ll be doing everything I can to avoid flying Southwest in the future.

Not Verified |  Very disappointed with Southwest Airlines! The original flight was canceled approximately 2 hours before flight. Family was traveling to the airport causing lost time, expenses, and confusion. No other flight were available. After almost an hour delay the airline finally answered the phone. A wasted 2 hour trip to the airport only to turn around and drive home. Flight was rescheduled 1 week later and early bird check in was dropped. Unbelievable hassle. Not to mention the loss of time spent with my son, who visits just a few weeks a year.

Currently ongoing. Typically have recommended this airline, but this has been a horrible experience. Our flight from STL to Portland, ME had our connecting flight in Baltimore canceled. Customer service was horrid and had to eat money on 2 hotel rooms for that night; the impromptu one and the originally scheduled one. Lost a full 24 hours waiting on the flight we got rebooked for. On the rebooked flight, we paid extra for A-boarding, but due to their system issue or something their personnel forgot to do in the computer with pur luggage, we got kicked out of line and had to go to customer service; nothing about us getting refunded that money. Now, flying back from Portland via Chicago to STL, showed up to airport and flight immediately delayed 2 hours. As plane touched down and getting ready to board, announced another 45 minute delay due to "weather." Checked weather in Chicago: beautiful. Weather here: beautiful. Weather in-between: nothing. It's all staff, but they're walking all over their customers using Weather as an excuse to keep from compensating anyone.
route: Portland to Chicago via St Louis

comment: Not Verified |  As my departure time neared, I received several messages over the course of 2 hours. Each indicating an additional delay. This now meant I had no hope of making my connecting flight. I called to reschedule for the next possible flights to my destination. After waiting a half hour on hold, I explained my situation to a human, and was asked to be put on hold while he found me another flight. As I had already looked up possible flight schedules, I thought this would be a quick hold, as there were very few possibilities. After 40 minutes on hold, I was hung up on. Now, I have to call back. This time it only took 15 minutes to get a human, so I should consider myself lucky, right? I explained everything over again, and apologized if I sounded irate (which I was). This time, I just told the woman which flight I wanted. I then inquired about what she could do to make me feel better about flying Southwest, ever again in the future. I suggested a simple upgrade to 'A' on my boarding pass, to get me on the plane earlier, so I might get a window seat. This would have cost the airline nothing, and would have made me feel like they were actually sorry about my being quite inconvenienced. She said she couldn't do that, but could give me a discount on my next flight (which would cost them). I told her I didn't want a coupon for a flight I might never take, and she asked if I'd like to speak to someone about it. I said that I would like to speak with a supervisor, and was about to insist on not being put on hold, when...I was put on hold. I'm not one to give up easily, so I waited on hold... for an hour and a half, before I was forced to hang up because I had to leave home for my new flight at 3am, and it was almost 11pm. Now I'm going to be late for an appointment at my destination and get only 4 hours of sleep. I have great respect for Southwest flight personnel, but their customer service absolutely awful! And, I'm unlikely to fly with them again, because of that.
route: Albany NY to Chicago (Midway) via Oklahoma City OK

comment: Southwest Airlines is a nightmare. I have never encountered airline staff so horrific in my lifetime. When we arrived at our gate to board 10 minutes early, they yelled at us to haul our butts on board and that we were “late”. Except they failed to tell us that our actual flight was at another gate, instead, all 3 staff members yelled that we were on a different flight and how dare we try to board this one…except this was the gate and time our tickets stated. They refused to even look at our tickets to find out which gate they moved our flight to. After 10 minutes of sitting feeling confused, I went back up to them and asked where we were supposed to board our flight that our tickets said was boarding at that time and that exact gate we were waiting at. The guy sheepishly realized that they just about caused us to miss our flight which had been moved 10 gates down…instead of letting us know right away, they shamed us for following the information on our tickets and demanded we get out of their faces. Unbelievable.

header: "I will never give them my business again"
comment: Southwest Airlines took $3,650.76 on May 27,2022 and refused to refund my money for a flight that they had cancel due to inclement weather on that date. That same very date of May 27,2022, Southwest had rescheduled my flight to board a 5:50am flight to Denver, Colorado to get to Houston, Texas for my family of 10 vacation and charge me a additional $3,650.76 for another flight. Southwest had dispense my older children luggage to 2 different states which was Houston, Texas and my twins stroller Denver, Colorado and my medications went to Houston, Texas as well. Southwest took a total of $7,500 in less than 48 hours and my family never flew in the airplane. Southwest took $7,500, ship our luggage to 2 different states, cancelling our flight without proper notice and called the Sherriff department to follow my family around the terminal to give us a ticket that we currently have to see a judge about now to clear our name. On top of paying $7,650.76, Southwest ask me to pay more money for my twins when I had originally paid for them to board the plane. Southwest never gave my family an apology for all of the strife, chaos, shaming, belittlement that’s that my have put on my family.  I will never have my family to board Southwest ever again. I have lost all respect for this airline company. I have encountered some rude and unprofessional workers on the customer-service lines who talks fast pace to get you off the line. Southwest promise my family a flight on 5/28/2022 blast 5:50am, they let my family board the plane as a touring experience, sit down on plane, then ask all of us to exit the plane. My personal preference will be to never paid or even board this airline again. If you want to get rip off, taking advantage of, swindle out of your hard earn money than choose this airplane as your 1st choice. After they refund my $3,650.76, I will never give them my business again. It’s way to many competitors of airlines in the world to be settling for less and making a joke out of people family members just to enjoy a family vacation that you have save for.

header: "Never again will I book this airline"
comment: So after 3 years, I decided to fly on SW airlines again. I've always had an amazing experience with this airline. They delayed my flight 10 minutes before boarding for 3 hrs. (It said on time even when the plane landed and was at the gate). They said it was the air traffic control in MCO. I checked the flight delays on all airlines. There were only 2 (that were non SWA, SWA had tons). Even frontier and spirit had none. AA was flying nonstop with no cancelations.  I then was cancelled and put on standby. I stood at the airport all night until all planes were exhausted (along with other families that had been there way longer than I had). I never got on a plane. In the mean time, I booked a ticket on AA. I asked for a hotel/motel voucher (they laughed). So I took a ride to DFW from Dallas love with a trip booked in the morning. I had to pay for the motel room. I never cancelled my flight. My thought was maybe I'm wrong. The data is lying to me. Yet, I was right. I got on that flight with AA with no problem. I monitored my standby/alternate ticket situation with SW the entire time in air and off. It kept getting pushed back over and over again. To the point that it was landing 3 days from the point I booked. I canceled. I'd love to give my credit to someone needing a flight, but I cannot. I'm the only one it works for.  Never again will I book this airline! They are worse than Spirit or Frontier. BTW, My AA ticket coming back was not delayed or canceled either. I'm sure some have had problems with AA and many other airlines. But, I haven't.

I’ve historically loved Southwest. The two free bags, open seating, reliable flights and communication were excellent. But now this airline is nothing short of a vile, greedy company. In the past year, more than half of my flights have been significantly delayed or outright cancelled. Any getaway comes with an asterisk - best not to make any plans at the destination and save yourself the disappointment. Short notice and some excuse that always dodges responsibility has saddles the customer alone with huge last minute re-booking or hotel fees. To be fair, they always compensate you with a $100 LUV Voucher, which you can put toward the cost of your next Southwest flight, when you’ll inevitably get to repeat this whole process again you masochist. At least there are stale bags of pretzel crumbs to keep you satisfied as you sit and wait a few hours for that last-second cancellation.

Southwest is being horribly deceptive. I recently booked a nonstop flight from RDU to FLL and it was changed to RDU to Baltimore, to Pittsburgh, then to Ft. Lauderdale. Not only is adding 2 stops ridiculous but the fact that you let me book a nonstop and then try to put me through hell with 2 stops is unacceptable. What is going on and what is up with the deception. I cancelled the flight and rebook on another airline. Southwest is the worst by far, never had such stupid things happen with other airlines. It is down right abhorrent that they think this is acceptable.

A simple 1 hour flight. Not that hard right? Came to the airport 2 hours before boarding to park, eat lunch, and check my 1 bag since Southwest brags about how great it is to check bags with them. And they never loaded my bag. It’s two days later and I’m still waiting on my bag. Call their rude customer service who gives me attitude saying the only thing they’ll do is reimburse if I show receipts for the crap their incompetence forced me to buy (but only if I prove it’s solely for me). They are truly the worst airline in the USA.

header: "I took three different flights today and all were late"
comment: Not Verified |  Really a horrible airline. How they have fallen. Unorganized, clueless employees. Stuck on tarmac in Dallas for over an hour. No explanation. Way overbooked. I took three different flights today and all were late. No weather problems. Seats are for children only. I would give a days pay for the CEO to ride cross country in his planes.

Not Verified |  I am beyond mad! I booked a flight for an employee and when she went to check in online it said they couldn't find her reservation. I called the airline and they said they canceled the reservation due to fraud. There was already a charge on our card. No one had reported this as a fraudulent charge. Southwest offered no real explanation except they bank declined the charge. What bank? It was an Amex and the charge already showed up! Southwest offered no solution, just a sorry. My company flies employees all over the US. I will never use Southwest Airlines again.

header: " made it home after 2 days of sheer hell with Southwest"
comment: Not Verified |  Worst flying experience of my life. Trying to get home from Salt Lake City to Fort Myers Florida, sheer hell. Flight from SLC to DEN was delayed then cancelled. Which caused us to have to stay overnight and SW did not pay for any accommodation’s. Had to pay for hotel, food and then more cash for airport food. Southwest rescheduled a flight to get us home which caused us to have to get up at 3.30 am to catch a flight by 5.30 am only to find when we got at the gate that the flight was not going straight to Midway Michigan as was on the ticket, no. We were going to Houston, take off land, deboard all those passengers, onboard all those passengers. Then fly to Panama City, deboard, onboard passengers, then to Midway. 10 hours sitting on a plane with only 2 bags of snacks since 3.30 am in the morning. Then arrive at Midway to find that flight was delayed. Then delayed again. Finally boarded that flight and made it home after 2 days of sheer hell with Southwest who could not have cared less. None of the employees cared less. Plane was so cold the man sitting next to me called it a meat locker. I had to stay wrapped in fleece and blankets and scarves. No one cared. Their employees are immune to everything because this happens all the time and I’m sure they get screamed at all day. But customers can’t even speak up for fear you will be considered unruly. Ruined what was a wonderful vacation to Moab. We will never use Southwest again. If you want them to screw up you life for days then this is your airline.

header: "I stood in line for 1/2 hour to check in"
comment: Not Verified |  You really take a chance getting to Nashville Airport especially with the crazy traffic. I was flying out of Nashville on Southwest Airline. I live 2 hours away. You could at any time be in a traffic jam for 2 hours. I was lucky arrived 4 1/2 hours early. So I stood in line for 1/2 hour to check in. Oh no, you can't check in. You are too early. Apparently you can't check in with Southwest Airlines more than 3 hours early. Who knew. So I went and sat for another hour and watched people. Very interesting. It's better than being late. Boarding the plane, my seating pass was in the B section. I usually go toward the rear but every seat I wanted was being saved by the passenger next to it. So I had to actually turn around along with other passengers behind me so I could find a seat. Did not know that you are allowed to save seats on Southwest. The stewardess just shrugged her shoulders and asked people to back up. What a mess. What is the point of paying an extra $15 to get to board early.

I flew from Phoenix to Burbank last night on flight number 3699, upon out entry into the plane, we were greeted by a flight attendant, Amy. Her pleasant welcoming was wonderful and the same happy and pleasant tone continued, during the flight instruction, as she served until we exited the plane.  I have been flying for years, but have not seen such a remarkable attendant.

Not Verified |  This airline is absolute rubbish. I've had the misery of flying with SW when there have been no other nonstop available for the required travel days, and they never cease to amaze with how 3rd world they are. Wanna get away? No...more like: wanna buy a scheduled flight? Or, wanna purchase an overbooked flight? How about a 6 hr delay followed by a cancelation with absolutely no explanation? Then Southwest is your airline. 0/10, wouldn't recommend to an enemy.

header: "tell me that it is too late to board"
comment: Staff services at La Guardia Airport was horrible. I come before time flight of 1 hours and 30 minutes after check in online. I just need drop two bags. However the printing tag for bags doesn't work. I have to wait someone help. Nobody care about me. They let me wait until I can see a gentleman tell me that it is too late to board. They tell me go to Tennessee then catches an other flight back to Maryland. I call my family, my family tell them change me to Long Island airport to get flight to Maryland. Only drop two bags but they make me miss my flight. What is the service?

header: "disappointed with what they have turned into"
comment: My review is about the customer service I have been receiving. My last two times of flying have been pretty much very dissatisfying. When I flew to Florida in June my flight got canceled I had a book at a hotel I lost a days vacation couldn’t get my money back from the hotel. Then this flight that we just came back from they change the flight so many times that when you add up the loss we took in our time vacationing we lost a whole day. Then I try to use my vouchers and my guest certificate that I got from some friends to book my Southwest vacation. And they wouldn’t take it. But I asked them to extend the six months that I had to use them and they won’t. So they took my money they stole my money. I’ve been flying with Southwest for 12 years I’m so disappointed with what they have turned into.

They cancelled my flight from point A to B to C. Point A to B was cancelled due to a snowstorm. I called and asked if they could undo that because I could catch the connecting flight from point B to point C, but they said that it would be an additional $700 if I wanted to do that. Are you kidding me?
route: Colorado Springs to Denver via Detroit

header: "they will never have me fly again"
comment: Waited for over an hour with no explanations. Rude staff no trust worthy to plan a trip around. You would be much better off the pay more to fly Delta. This is the last straw for Southwest, they will never have me fly again.

Lihue to Los Angeles. Literally flight was empty and I had one carryon and backpack. Decided to go grab some chocolates as gifts and the gate agent forced me to check my bag to LA because I had purchased the chocolates (basically empty flight). When I boarded the plane even the flight attendants were in shock as to why she would make me gate check the bag. Had I known I would have just left the $50 chocolates, not worth having to check my bag. This is why I never fly SouthWorst, I should have know that this airline is bad but I took a chance, never again. It’s sad when even the flight attendants when I boarded were apologizing for the gate agent. Book a normal airline.

I have flown Southwest Airlines my whole life. I have to say they have been great up until this year. Over the course of 20 flights, 7 have been canceled and 8 have been delayed. I am on a plane today for a 47 minute flight that is delayed because a suitcase machine broke. I mean come on. It is time all airlines are held responsible for this ridiculous service.

As the pilot is doing his safety briefing over the intercom (which they have to mandatorily do before takeoff), the Flight Attendant is going through the motions very sarcastically and making funny faces as the pilot is explaining the expectations, roles, and responsibilities of the personnel on the plane if it was to crash.  I then hear the FA  getting upset about someone's luggage "poking out in the way". He wasn't very calm about the situation and was on edge.  The messages from the Pilot and the head Flight Attendant kept coming, and I kept listening. I had my Earpods in but paused my music every time a message would come over the intercom. Even with my music paused, I could not understand what was being said over the intercom. I asked the FA  about what beverages they had. He looked at me like I was speaking another language and made drastic body motions pointing at his ears. I knew what he meant but was still shocked that this flight attendant was having such a horrible attitude towards everyone on the plane.

Not Verified |  Flight was running late on return trip home. It was a late flight, crew did not clean plane, it was filthy. I understand mask are no longer mandated which I am against, but cleaning and sanitizing the plane after passengers depart before new passengers board should be mandatory.
route: Tampa to Buffalo via Midway Chicago

header: "level with us what the problem is"
comment: Not Verified |  I have always flown Southwest if at all possible. I want to let you know that my last few flights have been delayed. I think it would serve you well to not give some lame, maybe even untrue response about these delays and just level with us what the problem is. Everyone knows about employee issues and shortage of pilots anyway. The truth is always best
Took 9 hours to get home. Southwest kept delaying my flight. No one around to answer questions. This is totally ridiculous. I need a response to what went on before I fly Southwest again.
route: Salt Lake City to Las Vegas

header: "a little over $100 to change my flight"
comment: Wasn't happy I had to pay a little over $100 to change my flight home because of a messed up flight that would have had 2 stop and taken ten times longer when I always fly through Denver. I should have been able to change it once without being charged. Ridiculous

header: "Never ever again will I fly Southwest"
comment: Never ever again will I fly Southwest. They canceled the flight but said they can’t pull any bags off canceled flights, even though I didn’t have any connections. So now I’m stuck with an extra $50 Uber fee since they refused to give hotel vouchers and don’t have anything to get ready tonight or tomorrow morning.

Louisville to Buffalo via Tampa. I had to abruptly leave a business trip when I found out my dog was very ill with little chance of survival. The gate attendant was extremely helpful making sure I had all the proper connecting information, as well as organizing all of my previous cancelled flight information and credits. Once on my first flight the flight attendant was so incredible when I told her about my concern for our delay and the if I did not make my connecting flight I would not make it home in time to say goodbye to my dog. She kindly asked all the people on the plane if they could sit and allow me to get off first and asked everyone to keep my puppy in their hearts. I do not know the name of this wonderful flight attendant, but I will never forget her.

header: "didn't put my bag on my plane"
comment: Not Verified |  My plane was delayed for an hour in Denver. I checked my bag before my partners. When we get to Desmoines her bag arrived and mine didn't. Come to find put they didn't put my bag on my plane when they had a while extra hour to do so. Southwest tells me I can get it on the next flight. I go to get my bag and that flight was delayed till 11pm. They tell me they will call me and I can get it in the morning. I arrive at 10am and no one available to give me my bag.

I called the Southwest Airlines customer service line about an issue I had when flying from Chicago to Vegas. They did not care and literally said there is nothing we can do. I get on the airplane and they say things are not working on it. Now I am on my way back from Las Vegas to Chicago and we are over 1hr late. Once again no one cares. Please read reviews before spending extra money on tickets like my business class ticket that does not mean anything.

Deplorable customer service! They deserve a negative star. I flew from Syracuse to Charlotte 4/24 when I get my stroller bag I noticed it was partially unzipped, when I go to get the stroller out I see both wheels are broken off and placed under the stroller. The top bassinet/carrier part was also disconnected, which was connected when I checked it in and zipped it up. I know my stroller was intentionally dismantled to make it fit smoother under the plane. I went to the ticket counter where Diane and a manager both told me they do not cover damages only losses. They filled out a report and said I can try to talk to customer service to see if they will replace it. I was sent home with no replacement and no check to replace my infant's stroller. Quickly forward to 5/1, I flew from St. Louis back to Charlotte again, only to have my car seat that I checked in not put on the plane! Once again Diane was at the ticket counter and gave me a loaner car seat. However, my car seat was also in a travel bag that needed to be replaced. Diane brought out the replacement car seat in a travel bag, but refused to loan it to me. I asked to speak to the manager and advised her when Southwest delivers my car seat and travel bag I will give them both (car seat and car seat bag) of theirs back. We stood there for about 30 minutes going back and forth. 20 minutes in she ask me to verify my name as if I had just walked up like Diane didn't already do it. Diane had already got my ticket and verified who I was (which is how I got the loaner car set from the beginning of the ordeal). Security was called, the manager said she couldn't believe I was acting like this and refused to give me the name of her regional manager. When I asked for her to write down her supervisor's name she refused and said you can take it down yourself. She started talking through her teeth at me like I was a child and threatened to walk away if I recorded her. If your acting professionally you wouldn't care if someone recorded you. Everyone after the gate and above the ground were great. Southwest train your ticket counter employees and ramp agents to treat people and their property with respect.

Not Verified |  The absolute worst! I cannot even keep track of how many times I was screwed over by Southwest on this one trip. Booked non-stop both directions flight was changed to connecting, paid for earlybird check-in it never happened - somehow the computer dropped it they said - with zero help or solution to the problem so we were last to board the plane and you know they are messed up with their policy of not letting you choose a seat is the stupidest thing I've ever seen so goodbye Southwest it was nice knowing you.

Not Verified |  Planned a trip months in advance and had the perfect times we wanted for nonstop flights only for it to be changed last minute to a two stop flight that was hours later. Had our whole trip planned perfectly and all then of a sudden we have to scramble to find new flights for no reason. The audacity of Southwest Airlines is unreal. I cannot believe this is how we are being rewarded for using Southwest Airlines for over 15 years.  I have never been so personally insulted by an airline in my entire life.
Not Verified |  Great customer service from check-in to disembarking. On the inbound we had some delays but staff had informed us about them. I would recommend Southwest Airlines!
route: San Antonio to La Guardia via Houston Hobby and Dallas Love

comment: I arranged Nashville to Las Vegas travel thru Southwest. It was a special occasion and purchased Business Select ticket and paid premium price. Only thing I got additional is to check in quick and one drink coupon for each traveler (it is $7.00/ per drink if you buy your own). This is total disappointment and not worth to by Business Select.

Not Verified |  This is about customer service. We created a credit card with Southwest last year. They had two sets of nonstop flights to Virginia, which made it easy to travel to see my parents, which was important because we have two small children. A 5-hour flight with a layover has turned into a 12-hour flight due to delays, which isn't easy with small children. Imagine an unplanned 5 hours in the Dulles Airport. Well, these flights were in place throughout COVID, and were full, always. As soon as COVID started to lift, these flights disappeared. Gone. Now, we have at least one stop and more frequently, 2 stops to get to our destination. The same is true for my husband's family in New York. Southwest used to fly direct, and they dropped the direct flights. Today, I was on the phone trying to apply travel vouchers. I was under the impression that I needed to book travel within the expiration timeframe, not complete travel within the expiration timeframe. I have work travel that happens less than a week after the expiration date, and together with this misunderstanding, I thought maybe Southwest would help me out. No such luck; told me it's my problem. Obviously, it is my problem, but I hoped that an airline whose hold message (which I listened to for 20 minutes while my customer service agent took other calls instead of helping me) repeatedly talks about how much they care about customers, might have some flexibility in such a short timeframe. Other businesses help people out to maintain positive customer relations; too bad Southwest has turned a corner and is no longer actually serving the customer. That's why I was loyal to them in the first place. No longer.

They don't assign seats. If there's an issue how do you know whose in what seat. My main issue was I wasn't feeling good after we landed and I asked for ginger ale and the flight attendant said "we don't give drinks out after we land. It wasn't like I was asking for a beer. The flight was delayed but yet the monitors said on time. When they finally told us the flight was delayed, they said it's possible we will board on time so don't leave the area. If we are delayed how can we board early?b You don't have to worry about me flying your airline again. For $1300 it's a waste of money. Couldn't get Wi-Fi nor any entertainment. It wouldn't work.

header: "I was so upset with this crew"
comment: Not Verified |  Normally love SW. My 4:05 pm flight on 4/14/22 had the absolute worst flight attendant crew I have ever had on any  airline and we have been flying regularly (monthly) for more than 30 years. They were rude to many passengers including my husband and I over trivial things that normally aren’t a big deal. An under-seat item being slightly close to the passengers feet not 100% under and I mean slightly as in barely even noticeable, face mask covering nostrils but not up to bridge of nose, giving a family with a screaming child a hard time during landing, husband lowered mask to tell me something bc I couldn’t hear him and she went off on him, etc. The entire three hour flight with this crew was ridiculously awful. They were not pleasant when coming around for drinks or trash. They acted like they had a chip on their shoulder about something. Normally SW attendants have great personalities and offer decent humor on the flight but you got none of that with this gang. The only time they were nice was when announcing their “we know you have a lot of choices and we thank you for choosing SW” spiel at the end of the flight. If I hadn’t had so many great experiences with SW, I wouldn’t book again. I hope this was an isolated incident bc this crew was lousy and rude. I’m refusing to offer anything but a single star in all categories as I was so upset with this crew but I had no issues with the ground service. The seats are not any more or less comfortable than any other larger airline and the food and beverages  are comparable as well. The inflight wifi was not working on any of my SW domestic flights this week so that was annoying as well.

More than an hour delay with no transparency about why we've been sitting on the plane for the last hour. Getting back at 230 am or later now. This time of the day is the least amount of air traffic you will ever see - why are we still sitting here? Thanks Southwest.

The absolute worst airline. I wanted to give Southwest another try because a family member raves about the service. I decided to give them another try. Huge mistake. Flights not on time. Sure this airline is cheap but the value and customer service you get is suspect and chances are, your flights going to get cancelled. What happened to this airline? Pay the extra money for a different airline.
Stewardesses would not allow my carryon even though it met requirements. Then my bag was lost. My boarding pass had wrong information. TSA blamed Southwest Airlines. Southwest Airlines blamed TSA.

I flew twice on Southwest Airlines. Both times, my flights either got cancelled or the flight got delayed and schedules were changed multiple times since booking. I have horrible experiences with this airline flight cancellation and delay. I Would never fly with Southwest Airlines again. It seems this airline doesn't care about its customers' valuable time at all. I am not surprised when finding on this board so many negative reviews from people expressing the same feelings and frustration.

The flight attendant on this plane was much better than my original Experience heading out to Orlando on the 9th. He was very nice, made my sister feel very comfortable. She started having a panic attack and he comforted her and made her feel safe on the plane.

Chicago to Phoenix via Denver. I will never take Southwest Airlines ever again. They were horrible they changed the flight and I had to stay in Chicago another day which I was already there for 2 days. Didn't ask for a hotel because they told me that they don't have any more vouchers so I had to sleep at Chicago airport. The staff in Chicago airport was very unprofessional my luggage got to Phoenix before I did and then when I picked my luggage up in Phoenix, it was broken. Nobody could give me the answer to what happened. I will be sticking with Delta and American airlines from now on. I was traveling for my wedding, and we had to push it back for 1 day, which cost me and my hubby now a lot because I was late getting back to Phoenix.

header: "could not pre board unless in uniform"
comment: Not Verified |  I was highly unsatisfied when flying with Southwest. Being currently active duty, I was told I could not pre board unless in uniform. Anyone in the military knows you are a target when wearing your uniform in public places and are told not to. Southwest either needs to let all military members pre board or none at all. They say they support military but obviously not. Do not fly Southwest, unless you want to deal with rude, and nasty service.

Not Verified |  I want to complement the lady that I spoke to on the phone. Her name is Julie and she helped me a lot and she was extremely nice. She was very patient as I made a big mistake and we had to do everything over again.

Not Verified |  I would never recommend anyone fly with a company that does not care about it's customers. I bought a flight during very early COVID for $331. As the time for flying come near the warnings made me cancel. I rescheduled hoping the pandemic would calm. Again I cancelled. Since it was a certain fair they deducted $100 from my flight and issued a Luv voucher. This was only good for 6 months. I ended up scheduling for 8 months to fly again. Southwest told me I can't extend my voucher and took the other $221! I am out the $331 without ever receiving any services whatsoever. I contacted customer service to see if I could get any credit for my upcoming flight and they replied sorry. I'm sorry I ever booked on SW in the first place.

Not Verified |  Ridiculous delays. We boarded the plane late due to weather. That was fine but after sitting an hour and a half waiting to pull away from the gate, I am cross. The flight crew gave at least 4 different reasons why we could not take off and we are still waiting. I have flown only one Southwest flight in my life that was actually on time. Did I mention that my husband had just had surgery and the longer flight was painful.

header: "I am beyond frustrated with this airline"
comment: Not Verified |  I am beyond frustrated with this airline as a concerned mother whose child is flying alone for the first time. I called the airline over 10 times and received a different story each time, to make matters even worse you can't speak to a manager or a supervisor because apparently they have none. Eventually I found out you can talk to a service coordinator. No wonder no one's on the same page and they all give you different answers! Who trained them or taught them what the airline procedures are. They don't care that you can't afford for the flight to keep going up like they said they have no control over it but neither do they have control of the procedures. I couldn't even book my child a minor under my account because they are so worried about whatever point system they have going on. They obviously need a family plan where you can have your spouse and children under. Especially for someone who gets frustrated on the internet quickly. They have made the beginning of my trip with my daughter hell and my finances tight because they had to refund me and were so happy to book another flight because apparently I'm so rich. I can't wait 3 days till the refund comes in to get another flight because I would have lost the price I could pay. So I had to come up with money for another flight which of course went up the next day but hey at least she said "I'm Sorry".

header: "Southwest you are not the airline you used to be"
comment: Not Verified |  Will never trust Southwest Airlines again. What a fiasco trying to get out of Tampa on April 2nd. Eventually canceled our flight and offered absolutely no guidance on what to do at that point. Waited in line for information for 2 hours. Waited at baggage line for 2 hours to retrieve soaking wet suitcases. Finally decided to rent a car, in line for 3 hours and drive to Buffalo instead of waiting till Wednesday or Thursday for a new flight. I especially felt sorry for all of the families with children having to go thru the same ordeal as myself and my husband. Southwest you are not the airline you used to be.

Not Verified |  I have been a loyal Southwest customer but I am now looking for other options. Two days and two canceled flights is too much. I understand that may not be their fault but their customer service is no longer like it used to be. They are not helpful at all and you are just on your own which is very unfortunate. Right now I would be very gracious in giving them a 1 star rating. Very disappointed!

Not Verified |  Worst experience. Flight delayed more than 3 hours without cancellation and/or chance to reschedule. No documented bags returned. No apologies, super deficient customer service at the airport.

header: "reached out to see if they could extend my refund"
comment: Not Verified |  This use to be my favorite airline to fly with but that has changed! Customer service is not the same. Southwest in my opinion used to have the best customer service. I have flight refund that expires this year and due to being pregnant I have been told I cannot fly. I reached out to the airline to see if they could extend my refund since it expires in September and was told they will not do that.  Southwest just isn’t what it use to be and it’s disappointing.

Not Verified | New Orleans to Richmond via Atlanta. Not very pleased at all. A representative for Southwest during baggage drop directed us to an A list/priority line. After we waited 15 mins, when we were next in line; she redirected us yet again to ANOTHER line that was WAY longer and we barely made our flight from MSY to ATL (#2772) with 5 minutes to spare. We had to literally RUN so we wouldn't miss it. EVERYBODY had boarded ahead of us and the door to the gate was even closed. I'm still flabbergasted by this situation and will definitely keep this horrible experience in my head for future, possible flights with Southwest.
route: New Orleans to Richmond via Atlanta

comment: Las Vegas to Denver. I current flew with 3 of my co-workers from Denver to Las Vegas on March 30th. Flight number 486. We were delayed 3 hours due to a mechanical issue with the aircraft. Once onboard the head of the flight crew took the time to have a conversation and lighten the mood. Then the comedic events of the flight staff made for a great flight. Then returned on April 1st. Flight number 876. Again the laughter created by the flight staff made for a great experience.

Not Verified |  I had flown just yesterday. I was early, the line was ridiculous so I sent my 2 daughters to go shopping and stayed with my son. We all ate and come to find out our plane was delayed until 12 so we waited, then our gate changed and was delayed 2 more hours. They boarded us and all my children had to sit alone away from me. My daughter was only 12 and was crying the whole flight. Never flying southwest ever again.

header: "there was absolutely no form of assistance"
comment: Not Verified |  Absolute garbage, not only was the inside of the plane filthy, when we tried to use Southwest again to get home they cancelled the flight and didn’t provide any form of assistance in hotels-motels or even food. Was stuck in the airport all night would never use this airline. I try to be reasonable, but this is insane that there was absolutely no form of assistance given to me and the other 13 people I was with.

Southwest cancelled my flight prior to the flight about 12 hours and no additional flights were offered. I was asked to contact my agency and they simply did not care. They blamed technical/technology and weather but frontier or spirit airlines are working fully functional for the same route. Terrible company decisions and they just don’t care.

header: "Customer service has taken a real dive"
comment: Not Verified |  Flight (direct) was pushed back and fourth for 5 hours yesterday then cancelled and rebooked for 6:05 today (w/one stop) meaning a long drive back home and getting up in the middle of the night. The extra early bird charge was not refunded and not given back on the new flight. $40 due back. Once in Chicago things were delayed for a couple hours again. Unfortunately my wife and my daughter whom had a soccer game today to play in front of specific college coaches was operating on 3 hours sleep now. They arrived in Phoenix with no time to go to hotel and check in because HERTZ rental car (Zero stars) had a super long line and not enough customer service agents to handle them. Hertz cancelled our original reservation charged triple the price for the rental which was a downgrade, charged for overage hours and charged for insurance and prepaid gas full tank (they wont use) which was all declined. I'll talk with both of these incompetent companies the next couple days. If your traveling do your due diligence and fly the best airline at the best time of the week. Last but not least we cancelled one day at the hotel which ended up cancelling the whole stay leaving us to frantically find another hotel away from her team hotel. Looking at the internet and talking with many people today I believe that people should be cautious and think twice about booking flights with Southwest and Rental Cars with Hertz as many people have had similar experiences just not all at the same time/trip. Frustrated but safe. Customer service has taken a real dive since our last election in this country.

Not Verified |  I was a loyal southwest fan for 25 plus years. No more. After this fiasco of them cancelling flights I am done. Offered no hotel voucher no food voucher after waiting 4 hours in a line only to be told what I could have done myself. Offered to book us 4 days later on a flight - 4 days! We cancelled and got refunded and will now use competitor airlines. Let my wife, myself and our 2 kids down. Gone are the fun friendly customer service winning days at Southwest. Avoid them at all costs.

header: "does not care about stranding their customers"
comment: My wife and paid for a return home tickets months in advance. On April 2, 2022 our flight was rescheduled from 4 pm to 1130 pm. While waiting the long hours we were notified that the 1130 pm flight was canceled with not alternative flight scheduled. We were stuck in the Orlando airport with not means are reason for the cancellation. They have my paid ticket but canceled my flight without any additional information. The flight was initially canceled due to bad weather but as of 745 pm EST the weather is clear. A flight was boarded for Phoenix Arizona, I’m sure Houston Texas is before Arizona. This airline does not care about stranding their customers.

Not Verified | Detroit to Punta Cana via Chicago. What a joke. Pilots were over hours, but they told us it was the weather, but Delta, Spirit, and every other airline made it there. Way to go, Southwest will never fly again.
route: Detroit to Punta Cana via Chicago

comment: Denver to Chicago. Southwest has completely ruined my trip, i have missed my cousins wedding due to all the delays, cancelations and layovers today. I have had my flight canceled three times today. My original flight was scheduled to go non-stop Denver to Chicago O'Hare at 7am, that was canceled. I was rebooked for a flight leaving Denver at 5am with a layover in Austin, that flight was canceled. I was then rebooked for a flight out over Denver to Dallas that was delayed an hour. My then connecting flight from Dallas to Chicago O'Hare was delayed 5 times before being canceled. I am now booked on a flight to Houston and then to Chicago midway just to get me close to home. Canceled on three times, have been in an airport for 11 hours now, still have two flights to go which are not guaranteed not to be canceled and im not even flying to my home airport where my car is, i will have to pay $100+ for a ride from midway to O'hare and 12 hours after i was supposed to originally land. When i asked for some kind of compensation for my troubles and extra expenses, i was lied to by the supervisor at the gate saying i should’ve been offered vouchers this morning which i wasn’t because i was not at the airport when my first two flights got canceled and then she changed her story to say southwest could not provide compensation because my flights were canceled due to atc when in reality, as reported on the news, southwest as had a company wide system shutdown today which in fact is southwest’s fault and should compensation me for what will be almost 20 hours in an airport and/or plane, a 12 hour delay in my arrival to my destination, my arrival to the incorrect airport and my costs of a taxi from midway to O'hare.

Not Verified | Portland to San Diego. I had connecting flights from PDX to SAC to LAS to SAN. When we landed in SAC, the staff found me on the plane and let me know that there was a connecting flight leaving in 20 minutes that would be direct to SAN and get me there 3 hours earlier (since we just found out there was a delay). They took the initiative to make my experience great, arrive early, and feel confident my bags and tickets were taken care of (which was important flying alone with my kids). I highly recommend.

I missed the first leg of my flight and had to schedule 1 way. Now they canceled my return flight. I asked them how to resolve this issue and they said I needed to purchase another ticket (keeping the money from my original purchase that they canceled). Worst airline ever, worst customer service.

Computer problems again. Delayed flights for hours and this is just the start of the snowball effect to ruin the rest of my small business trip. Never flying Southwest again. Every time there's delays caused by their own shortcomings. I wish I could charge full amount and not provide my end of the bargain in business with no recourse.

They literally always disappoint. I am now stuck at the airport because their system is down. Was supposed to board at 4:30 am and currently still waiting they are delaying other flights as well as connections. I won’t be flying southwest anymore. They literally always delay and it’s ridiculous.

Not Verified |  I booked my hotel like I always do through Southwest to get points. I was to earn 10,000 points for my stay via the Southwest concierge. Usually my points hot within 4 days after travel is complete. My flight hit and my car rental hit. I was waiting to book a trip for my wife and I to Austin to celebrate a friends redo of their 50th birthday. Points still have not hit after 3 weeks and now I believe they are taking their time out of spite. Now they are telling me they have to wait for hotel to notify on how many points they need to apply to my account. This is complete rubbish, because it tells you how many points when you book and when you get confirmation email from Southwest. At the time the 10,000 points would have given me a total of 72,000 points and I could have booked a trip for us both for 69,000 points. Now it will cost 120,000 points. I travel about twice a month and it looks like this will increase to probably 3 times per month. Going to American Airlines now. Thanks for nothing Southwest. Hope it was worth it.

header: "feeling the pinch in terms of staffing"
comment: I flew to MegaCon last August and went with my dependable standby. The arrival flight took off on time but was 20 minutes behind (weather related), whereas departing flight back to RDU was delayed an hour due to custom issues with the Orlando aircraft arriving from Montego Bay. Even with the Delta surge, MCO was packed with people. Coming out of the pandemic, SWA is feeling the pinch in terms of staffing and aircraft availability.

Not Verified |  Shame on Southwest Airlines. My husband and I and our family have used Southwest for over 20 years. This past March 12 we were supposed to leave Portland Maine at 5:30 in the morning and we received a cancellation for no reason on March 11 at 11 PM in the evening. We could not get through to the site via Internet or phone on how to reschedule a new flight. Since we had reservations for two weeks in Orlando all paid for we needed to get on a flight as soon as possible. So my husband tried and tried and waited on hold for almost an hour before he finally just gave up and decided to book a different flight and the only one we could fly find was from Boston which is a 2 Hour Drive instead of a 15 min drive to Portland. The only flight we could find was for 530 leaving Boston that morning which meant we had to leave Portland Maine by 2 AM. We did not sleep at all that night. On top of that the flight that was connecting was delayed as well. The real kicker is that because we did not follow Southwest Airlines rules for rescheduling a canceled flight we had to pay $700 more to drive two hours longer to get to the airport to actually get on a flight. And the person who answered our phone call later on was like oh well too bad you didn’t do it the way you were supposed to. I just don’t understand how a an airline can cancel the flight out of the blue for no reason and not assist their travelers. and then along the way the attendants were rude and obnoxious and in no way helpful or kind. We are still trying to figure out how we can get refunded our money over something that we did not do we did not cancel the flight Southwest airlines canceled the flight. They should honor the fact that we had booked our flights months ahead of time. And they should do a better job when canceling a flight to assist customers and getting to where they need to be.

header: "I just won’t fly SWA to New England during the winter"
comment: Went to attend 90s Con in Hartford, CT for the weekend beginning 3/11. Outgoing departure was on time, good customer service and unproblematic plane change. But due to the winter weather, SWA cancelled my return flight on Sunday—and they didn’t notify me until an hour before my flight was due to leave (via email). They rebooked my flight for Tuesday and I couldn’t do it. I ended up booking a last minute flight on Delta—that got delayed as well — so I ended up staying an extra day. I wish these big airlines had contingency plans for getting customers home. Had SWA rebooked me for Monday I would’ve been happier. Anyway, it worked out for me — both airlines sent me flight vouchers (SWA sent me a $250 one) and I got home fine. I just won’t fly SWA to New England during the winter.

header: "pay double to fly with a real airline"
comment: Been sitting on this plane since 7.35. Flight supposed to take off at 8. It's now 8.20 and no sign of movement. Someone actually just got on the plane 20 minutes after take off time. And still on the app, it says this flight departure is on time. What a joke. I'd rather pay double to fly with a real airline.

Not Verified |  We had our flight home canceled and were notified by text 6 hours before hand. No help re-booking or anything just left to us to call and figure it out. After hours on the phone we got re-booked on the next available flight which was 2 days later. Cost us over $1,000 in car rental extension and hotels and meals. Found out cancelation was not due to bad weather but told it was due to air traffic control issues whatever that means. So we sent a request for Southwest to pay our extra expenses and they said "yeah I know I left you, your wife and 2 children stranded for 2 days for ambiguous reasons but hey here is a $150 voucher to fly on our airline again". Really? I guess that is fitting because with the voucher and another $100 cash I might be able to get a one way ticket, maybe, leaving me stranded again. Southwest stopped caring long ago.

header: "Shame on you Southwest for not having more heart"
comment: Not Verified |  My husband had been an A-List member of Southwest Airlines for over 20 years. He traveled extensively for his work and we always appreciated the special perk he received of priority boarding due to his status. When Covid hit and all airlines came to a halt, his company put a moratorium on all travel - even after the airlines were back up and running. Last fall he received a promotion from Southwest that if he traveled one round trip flight anywhere, he could retain his A-List status. Unfortunately, he had been diagnosed with cancer back in the spring of 2021 and began undergoing cyberknife treatments in September 2021. His doctors specifically told him he should not travel through the remainder of the year as he was immunocompromised. We contacted Southwest and let them know the situation. The agent with whom I spoke advised that if we could provide a certification from his oncologist, they would consider our request to extend his status despite the fact he was unable to travel even the bare minimum in 2021. Yesterday, after going through a second appeal process following an initial denial of our request from Southwest, we were told they would not be able to honor our request. I am absolutely appalled that this airline, which our entire family has supported religiously for the past 20 years (in addition to all of my husband's business travel), would not consider these extenuating circumstances and grant him an exception. Shame on you Southwest for not having more heart. Perhaps if someone in a leadership role is faced with the same daunting cancer diagnosis and finds themselves undergoing this brutal treatment, they'll reconsider this ridiculous policy. We couldn't be more disappointed at this time in the airline and its leadership.

Not Verified |  We were flying on March 21, 2022 from Maui to Honolulu at 1.30 pm. It was a very hot day and my 8 year old daughter was very thirsty. The water fountain at gate 13 was broken so I told her we get water in the plane. It was a 30 minute flight so I knew there wouldn’t be service during flight. We were at the back of the plane, it was completely empty and I saw a male and female flight attendants at the back, 4 seats away from us. They were boarding the front of the plane. My 8 year old went to asked the lady for water very politely and she turns to my kid and says "No, sit down" in a very rude way. My kid came back so I went and asked the gentleman if he could please give me some water for my kid. He literally reached in front of them on a cart and gave me a blue can of water. I said to the lady, "my kid just wanted water and it was right in front of you, that was mean" she followed me to my seat and said something, I said the water was right in front of you. She raised her voice and said "Do we have a problem here?" At that moment I figured she wanted to get a reaction out of me, maybe to kick me off the plane so I said "no, no problem, I’m sorry". Never flying this airline again. Inhumane to a child that all she needed was a cup a worker.

header: "the only bad thing was really the seating system"
comment: Not Verified |  Me and my family got rebooked to Southwest because Spirit got cancelled out of nowhere (and we are never flying Spirit again) but anyway the treatment was good and the wifi was good but the only bad thing was really the seating system where it’s first come first serve meaning everyone just chooses their seats upon boarding the plane. Everyone in my family was spread out and sitting next to random people and it was good besides that.

Not Verified |  My nonstop flight at 3.50 pm Sunday March 13th from Dallas to Tulsa was cancelled 24 hours before flight time. I received an email which I later found meant no text notification. They auto booked me for 10.00 pm flight, then was delayed two hours, which puts me getting home at 1.30 am. No apologies, no explanation was given, weather is one thing but cancelling a fight because you didn’t sell enough seats is terrible customer service. Especially when I’ve been a loyal client for decades. I was really disappointed with this company. Way too many delays and cancellations in the past year. Covid is over and no longer an excuse. My time is way more valuable than buying an inexpensive plane ticket. I will be finding a new carrier when my points and funds are gone. So sad what’s happening to them. Will not recommend anymore.
route: Love Field Dallas Texas to Tulsa Oklahoma

header: "savings are not worth the absolute madness"
comment: Not Verified |  I’ve flown a minimum of once a month with Southwest for the last year. At this point the savings are not worth the absolute madness the yo-yo delays and last minute cancellations cause. This airline has far too much uncertainty for anyone depending on reliability. Unless you are super flexible with departure and arrival time (by hours or days) , don’t waste your time and sanity on Southwest.

Completely cancelled my flight less than 2 hours before departure. Not even a single delay. Have asked for a refund multiple times and they have just sent two vouchers which I do not want to consider since I will not be flying with this airline again. Have tried contacting through email, Twitter, and Facebook - no response unless it’s a robot. Have waited on the line multiple times. Once they hung up after I said hello and the second time I had to hang up after 2 hours to go on with my life. Terrible airline and terrible customer service.

Not Verified |  I never book flights on low cost airlines with very high hopes. It started when I got to the gate, the staff was nice and they are enforcing very strict COVID rules, something very important in these times. Before long we were boarding, which was surprisingly easier than with other airlines. You got to choose your seat, which was nice (as long as your preferred seat wasn’t already taken), and the taxi and takeoff was smooth and uneventful. Once we had leveled off, the cabin crew came around with drinks and snacks, and while their selection was a little limited, I understand why they can’t have a vast array of refreshments. The cabin crew was very nice, and while there was no in flight entertainment, I don’t see that as a factor that lowers the experience value because it’s just so easy to bring your own entertainment on board these days. Our descent, landing, and taxi were smooth, and once we got to our gate, I exited the plane feeling refreshed at the experience I had just had.

header: "been on hold on the phone for 3 hours"
comment: Not Verified |  First customer service rep I called couldn’t help me and told me my flight was delayed when on the app and text message I received said it was cancelled. She told me she doesn’t understand why that’s happening and gave me another number to call. I have been on hold on the phone for 3 hours and still currently waiting for my call to be answered. My flight was cancelled 6 hours before we were supposed to leave. Not only is this incredibly inconvenient, but there are no flights going out until Wednesday night. A handful of other airlines are leaving Indianapolis and going to fort Meyers. Maybe if southwest stopped overbooking their flights, they wouldn’t constantly get cancelled and be blamed for “bad weather.”

header: "go to great length to please anyone"
comment: Not Verified |  I have been flying Southwest Airlines from the early 80's until now on and off. The reason I don't get to fly often is due to my work situations. However, when circumstances allows me my first choice is SWA.  For the first time my experiences with SWA my flight was cancelled by Air Traffic Control few days ago. I called SWA support to ask any flight out of MCO in the next 24hrs, and got the next day flight out from MCO. The person who helped me bent backward to find me a flight, even though it took me out of the way and longer time. This is the service you get even you are not a frequent flyer. Southwest Airlines go to great length to please anyone.

Not Verified |  Horrible! What has happened to this airline? We were supposed to fly at 9:30 yesterday. Delayed to 4:30. Then 9:30. Then cancelled. Forced to pay for a hotel in Orlando. Scheduled to fly today at 10:05. Already delayed which makes me doubt we make our connecting flight. So stressed.
route: Orlando to Dallas via St Louis

comment: Not Verified |  Worst experience I've ever had on a plane. Flight was 1/2 hour late taking off when captain and stewards shut down flight to accommodate a panicky customer. We wait another hour, prepare to de-ice and take off when another customer needs something out of the cargo hold. Flight shuts down again. Customer reps come aboard to relay that all connecting flights are cancelled because there's no way to get there in time. Chaos ensues as half the plane de-boards. A single customer service rep, who has no idea what she's doing, attempts to coral all fifty passengers and fails. What a waste of three hours of my time. Poor communication, time and customer management. Will not use this airline again, don't recommend them.
route: Pittsburgh to Fort Meyers via Atlanta

header: "Becoming one of the worst airlines you could fly with"
comment: Not Verified |  Becoming one of the worst airlines you could fly with, late to everything! We have flown Southwest for years now and they are more worried about getting the most amount of flight tickets bought and not about proper customer service.

Every time I inadvertently fly with them I regret it. Besides the lack of comfort and amenities they they offer, they also are the only airline company that makes boarding as difficult as possible. Also their support of US Service Member traveling on Govt Orders is only superficial. Meaning they will only accommodate service members of people can witness it.

Not Verified |  My review is for the Southwest staff at the Phoenix Sky Harbor airport. It wasn’t crowded. There were no long lines. And yet every desk employee was rude, grumpy, non-smiling, and abrupt. My questions were met with sour looks, wrong information (it turned out), and I have MS and although I don’t appear disabled, I walk with great difficulty. My husband was with me. We needed a wheelchair. There were no pushers at all and we were treated like it was too much to ask or expect. We weren’t blaming Southwest about the wheelchairs but that is who we had to ask for it. But that wasn’t a main issue. The desk agents in arranging our new flights treated us like scum under his feet, he made mistakes, instead of answering our questions he said “You’re done so move away.” My husband was trying to push my wheelchair, I was rolling my carry on beside me, my tote on my lap, my husbands back pack We had been stuck in Phoenix 2 nights due to weather. We were smiling, respectful, polite and understanding…on purpose. It didn’t help. He again told us to get out of the way quickly. In 2 days, back at the airport, after our new flight didn’t show on the APP, waiting on hold 3 hours, never receiving the previously requested call back, Finally we got an email with the flight confirmation. The desk agent had no one else in line, and couldn’t find us in the computer. My husband looked up the email with the confirmation to show her and she rudely said ”I don’t want to see any phones. Don’t show me papers (we hadn’t). You aren’t booked.” We were but somehow she couldn’t find us until she tried for over 10 minutes. Not sure if it was system or human problem. Ok so no wheelchair pushers on duty so that was a wreck. I’m pushing 2 carryons beside my wheelchair, husband is carrying 2 items plus pushing. We get to security. No help at all. An agent said we needed a pusher and to go to the information desk and ask them to call for a pusher through security. The info man said ”I don’t know who told you that but I don’t do that.” So security was a mess. I can’t walk or stand long enough. I needed to stay in my chair. I was greeted with sour looks and impatience. when they asked if I could try to walk through the scanner. I can’t. And I can’t help my disease.  I waited a long time before a woman security person came to get me through. I didn’t mind waiting. I did mind being spoken to in such a rude manner. Because we had to check out of the hotel 6 hours before our flight, we had several hours to wait at the airport and gate. And the list of rude Southwest staff went on. I’ll stop here.
route: Puerto Vallarta to Kansas City via Phoenix

comment: My husband and I both have travel funds with the same confirmation number, but my funds are expiring this month and his in December. I contacted them to have them change my expiration date and they refused. It makes no sense. I have been an a-list customer for over 5 years, but they apparently do not value loyalty.

RNO-LAX r/t. As always, at least for us, Southwest is the best carrier out of Reno. Flight out was delayed by 30 minutes but we were kept well informed. In fact it turned in to only a 20 minute delay and an on time arrival in LA. Check-in, boarding and flight all went smooth. Served a drink and snack. Protocols for Covid were in place for the one hour flight which is no problem. Shocking airport traffic in the terminal at LAX for a Thursday evening but that has nothing to do with the airline. Flight out of LAX was remarkably smooth. Departure at 10.35 am and literally lifted off in air at 10.36. Arrived 15 minutes early in Reno. Used my points so flight was free except for $5 in taxes. Can't beat it. Good job Southwest.

header: "you pay for it with their customer service"
comment: Great price for airfares, but you pay for it with their customer service. They are lazy, do not take time to help their customers, and are selfish with their time. I was recently in Dallas airport and called the desk because their agent had made a mistake with my ticket. I accidentally left my AirPods at the desk. I boarded my plane and noticed they were missing. I quickly checked the location and called the desk. I explained I was already on the plane, so that I couldn’t get off. We had about 75 people still boarding, and the door was still open. The agent at the desk, said if I have time, I will walk them to your gate. (This was at gate 4/6, and I’m at gate 10, not far at all) of course, she did not have time, and now I’m being told I have to pay for FedEx to have them shipped back, and that’s if they are found. It’s so sad that they encourage laziness and the lack of customer service.
route: Dallas Love Field to Orlando, FL

header: "don’t care, as long as they get that $$$"
comment: Not Verified |  Within my four flights (to and from NM) there has been a total of 8 hours worth of delays/waiting. Our first flight we were going to NM from Maine, and, due to a technical error, my name was misspelled and it took staff a very long time both times to fix the name on the boarding pass (but I don’t blame the staff, I blame the system that Southwest uses). We were already there two hours early so we had time to do the things we needed to do before boarding, but Southwest Airlines will be giving you so much time that you won’t know what to do with yourself. We were told that the very first delay was due to the plane being “too heavy” because of passengers, baggage, and fuel. After they sorted that out, we were finally on our way. After we landed for our connecting flight in Baltimore, we waited an hour on the pavement to get to a terminal because all of them were full. Once we finally got to a terminal in Baltimore we had to haul butt to the other side of the Airport because our connecting flight was going to be missed (no thanks to Southwest). This being my first time flying, I decided not to let it bother me too much. However now that we are flying back, and dealing with the same extensive delays and terrible customer reimbursement of funds and services, I decided it might be time to give a cent. I’d like to note that all the staff have been so helpful and wonderful this whole time, the flight attendants and pilots have been extremely kind and apologetic for this airlines absurd behavior and policies. Right now, it’s 9:56pm in Baltimore and our flight was supposed to leave at 9:05pm. We were already delayed 30 minutes, and as soon as passengers started lining up to get on the delayed plane, someone on the intercom stated that suddenly the plane is unsafe to travel in, and therefore have cancelled that flight. They ended up keeping us in the dark for a while until we were told to move to Terminal B7 instead of B9. We’re awaiting the plane to leave that’s currently there so that a new plane can pull up. However I’m expecting at least an hour more of waiting because they will need to fuel, pack, and board the plane. Overall, I’ll give a 5 star rating to your very helpful, kind, and patient staff. I’ll give a 0 star rating to everything else. We were in the dark the whole time, and it was made very clear to us that if the airline messed up, it was on us. Southwest even over-boards the planes for profit with no guarantee of a seat. So if it’s overpacked and there isn’t a seat for you, someone is expected to voluntarily give up their seat. And if they don’t, I think they’ll try to find another plane for you but I’m not 100% sure - either way, what we’re they thinking? You don’t board a plane without plans? They don’t care, as long as they get that $$$.

Consistently late at every portion. First leg shifted my departure 2 hours earlier and almost missed my flight out. On the way back because of overfilling fuel and change of planes they Added a day to my trip, put me up in a motel with literally ceiling falling down. Then next flight first in the morning is 1.5 hour late. Over the last two years this has become the standard for southwest. What used to be one of the best airlines has been downgraded to frontier and spirit level. I do not recommend flying southwest if you are sensitive to time or events. Terrible for business planning. If you want free bags… sure they’re included.

header: "made my trip so much easier for me"
comment: Not Verified |  I just want to say thank you for the wonderful treatment for people with disabilities. You made my trip so much easier for me. Thank you so much!

header: "had to sit in the middle of 2 strangers"
comment: I flew Southwest airlines Phoenix to Seattle return. I was not impressed how their seating is now. I liked it better when it was assigned seating. My flight going to Seattle was fine. I traveled with my husband and i sat by him no problem. Coming back was a different story the plane was so full i wasn't able to sit with my husband. Now if if i wanted to go on a trip alone i would have. I did not like I had to sit in the middle of 2 strangers.  Definitely wasn't pleased at all with southwest.

header: "never had a issue with SW till today"
comment: I booked this flight around November for them to tell me that it’s cancelled and to then book me for a flight the next day? How are we over weight the day of the flight ? That’s something you should be keeping an eye on since you made the flight available, I’ve never had a issue with SW till today, I even opened a credit card with them a few months back, I’m about to close off because this is nonsense ! I paid for a non stop flight now I have to change planes (which I’m horrible at. I paid for A group and now I’m in a C group, way to ruin my day.
route: La Guardian to Denver via Baltimore

comment: Not Verified |  So they keep canceling all my non-stop flights and booking me on flights that get in at midnight etc and lose my luggage also. Cancelled my family's flights for Easter vacation to Disney World and never even re-booked us or even bothered to contact us and tell us. We found out by going online, where are our flights? Maybe we should call. The agent we spoke to said whoops, this is weird! Now we had to take whatever flight was left and arrive in Orlando at 11.45pm! Missed an entire day and paid full price. Do yourself a favor and stay clear of this airline! They simply cancel everything and rearrange your schedule and guess what you have no say!

Not Verified |  What a horrible airline. We probably had a once in a lifetime concert to go to in Phoenix that we booked 3 months ago. We did have snowfall today on Thursday that ended at 7pm. They canceled their entire flight schedule for the next day Friday to Phoenix. In fact all outgoing flights are canceled and we only had 4 inches of snow. My wife talked to the airlines multiple times and every time she was hung up on, she was polite and she didn't use profanity like I would have. I was on hold for 75 minutes and hung up. When I try to contact him again I was told I would be on hold for over 2 hours. We lost over 2,300 in hotel bills concert tickets and the flight. I will be surprised if I get reimbursed for the flight.

I been traveling once a month from Dallas to Houston for work, I leave early in the morning and return the same day in the evening since is a short flight I am able to do so. Since I started traveling to Houston none of the return flights left on time, at the beginning I was thinking one delay may happen but 10/10 delays? I also asked a cousin that works at the Love Field airport and she confirmed that Southwest is pretty famous for their flight delays and she hates it a lot because that also makes her stay working late - I will look for another option.

Not Verified |  My parents took a Southwest flight today from San Jose CA, through Houston to BWI. My mom had to be in a wheelchair and helped with entering and exiting the plane etc. When my parents got home they called me to tell me what an amazing experience they had the entire day with Southwest. How kind and helpful everyone was to them. They were beyond grateful
route: San Jose to Baltimore via Houston

comment: Open seating, you and your significant other will get split up. They will also split you up in boarding classes as well. Out of 1000 flights in my life this was literally the worst experience of my life.

header: "You will never get anywhere on time"
comment: Not Verified |  You will never get anywhere on time. This is my 4th flight in two weeks and none of them left on time. This is the third flight where we waited on the gate to open up and we have been waiting for an hour now.

I made the mistake of flying Southwest. The staff at the gate are rude and condescending. It's bad enough my experience going to San Antonio was bad. This just put the icing on the cake of the worse experience ever. It's going to take a lot for me to fly this airline again.
route: San Antonio to Los Angeles via las Vegas

comment: Very disappointed with Southwest. Will not be looking to fly with them again. Supposed to leave Colorado Springs at 8.15am. Didn't leave till almost 10.30 because of oil! Something that should have been done before loading! Just about missed my connecting flight because of it. Gave myself an almost 2 hour layover so that wouldn't happen. Finally got on connector plane at Chicago only for that plane to be shut off cause of technical problems. Southwest you are not making anyone feel safe in your planes!
route: Columbus to Colorado Springs via Denver

comment: Not Verified | I flew to Denver on December 21, 2021, with a return flight scheduled for January 3, 2022. I got caught in the biggest, most devastating fire ever in Colorado's history. My family and I were evacuated. This was a very traumatic experience and I was exposed to Covid. I tried to schedule a Covid test before the day of my flight but the earliest I could get an appointment was January 3. I bore the expense to drive home out of respect for other passengers and my inability to test due to the chaos and tragic circumstances surrounding the Marshall Fire. I received the following response today: Dear Brenda, We are sorry to learn that you were unable to travel as planned due to not feeling well, and we hope you are doing well. The reservation in question was booked at our Wanna Get Away fare, which carry restrictions such as being nonrefundable. And, while we wish we could honor every request to refund a nonrefundable fare, the reason we are able to offer these fares at such a substantial discount in the first place is because they are a firm commitment to travel. In this situation, the originally-ticketed Passenger still has the flexibility to apply these travel funds to a new reservation provided the reservation is canceled at least 10 minutes prior to travel and travel is completed by the expiration date. We are hopeful you will be able to travel with us soon. We know you have a choice when you fly, and we hope you will continue to choose Southwest. We would truly appreciate the chance to welcome you onboard soon.  I canceled out of respect for other passengers. Incidentally, I did have Covid making for a miserable drive home. I could have easily boarded that plane and saved myself a 14-hour drive on treacherous icy roads, not to mention the expense. SWA is more concerned about money than safety! I gave 24 hours notice and I guarantee my seat did not remain empty with all of the cancellations that were taking place at that time. I think SWA is despicable for putting the concern of other passengers behind the almighty dollar.

We had unused travel funds, that we were using to travel this month. My husband fell sick so to ensure everyone’s safety I had him take a covid test, which came back positive.
