I called the airline to let them know that we couldn’t complete our trip due to Covid and asked for a one time curtesy extension for one month. They said to call back after the funds expired, and they would offer a one time 6 month extension. The funds expired today, and I was told they would send me a voucher of $6 , and some change, because they have to deduct $100 as a penalty for not using the funds by the date. There was no way around it. Very disappointed, and will never be using Southwest again.

Not Verified |  Las Vegas to Honolulu. I was supposed to go on a trip the ending of this month but I had to reschedule because something came up so I called Southwest customer service and they told me that they could only extend it for 6 months and then today they called back and said I have only till the end of next month now - idk how is that possible?

Not Verified |  I recently came down with COVID and had to cancel several flights. Southwest was amazing - all I had to do was sign on the app, hit a button, and receive credit for a future flight. American had me on hold for 2.5 hours, and I still haven't been able to reach anyone. Holiday Inn was able to refund my flight, although I had to argue a bit. I hate their boarding process, but with this customer service I am forever a customer. Easy to do business with Southwest!

Today my husband and I headed back home to Texas from our honeymoon in Cancun. It was the absolute best flight we have ever been on even with the flight being delayed. All because of the incredible flight attendant, Tammy on our flight 308 on January 14th, 2022 at 7:30PM. She was so sweet to announce our celebration and even gifted us with an unforgettable memory of her generosity. Wish we could’ve thanked her more she went truly above and beyond. Hope to see our fellow Texan in the future!

Not Verified | We were supposed to fly back home to Oklahoma City on October 9th. On the day we were supposed to fly home, we received a text stating that our flight had been cancelled but had been rebooked for a 4am flight the next day. At approximately 3:30am we got a text cancelling that flight as well. Then they offered my wife a flight to Atlanta with no flight from Atlanta to OKC which then was cancelled as well. We had to get back home no later than Sunday so we drove down to the airport to find out what was going on. There was a mob of angry people  waiting on 2 employees to try to handle to issues. The employees stated that they had no information as to why all of the cancellations. Later, this issues became a national news story and SW said the cancellations were weather related but strangely, there were no other flights cancelled that day on any other airlines for weather related issues.

header: "Just rude, sarcastic and didn't want to be bothered"
comment: Not Verified |  Our flight going to Chicago, number 3134 on 1/6 2022, 6.25am. The attendant was very rude, my sister is handicapped, she is 69 yrs old. She asked the staff member if someone could put a carry on up above for her. The attendant sarcastically said if its too heavy you should check it in, so another passenger helped us. Our flight coming home was flight 1547, 1/9/22. Our attendants were sarcastic, they rolled their eyes when we asked for 2 drinks. If your employees are not happy they need to get other jobs. When we were at Tampa Airport Southwest counter, it was early but the ladies at the counter were not happy answering my questions. Yes it was 4am but its their job to answer our questions. Just rude, sarcastic and didn't want to be bothered. I am a customer paying for my flights, if they don't want to work early, then don't. I am not happy with how my sister and I were treated.

header: "5-days in and my bag was delayed another day"
comment: Due to weather my original flight was canceled and rebooked without my knowledge. Then there were multiple delays due to weather. Both I understood and accepted. However, with the chaos my concern now was with my luggage. And that concern was valid, now 5-days into a trip to visit my daughter I still have no clothes other than what I borrow from her. During this time they repeatedly gave me misinformation on where my luggage was and when it would arrive. At one point my luggage never left Texas but they assured me it was on a flight to Baltimore and and they'd call me when it arrived. Well at 6 I called and they said they were offloading it. Called back at 7 and they tell me it never left Texas. Not one time did they call me to tell me any of this or offer any type of apology for apparently lying. I called tonight to ask for the location of my luggage as it was due in today. Now 5-days in and my bag was delayed another day. The service representative tonight again lacked empathy to my situation and offered us a $100 voucher. In what world does a $100 voucher makeup for not having my luggage delivered to me for 6-days in the middle of winter. Of course I took it because it's something and I'm not that prideful but I am very upset. They only say they care, if they cared I wouldn't have to writing this review of how poorly their team treated me throughout this entire process.
route: El Paso, TX to Harrisburg, PA

header: "Why should I pay for business class if it does not benefit me"
comment: First, we stood in line for 1 hour and 15 minutes before we were able to even get to the counter flying Business Select then another 15 plus minutes to get checked in as the customer service rep looked all around instead of paying attention to what he was doing. It took 5 scans of each of our passports, 2 of us were traveling together. People were moving others to the front of the business line for tips. 1 counter working A List passengers that pay more for expedition to begin with, and we were solicited to tip more to get us to the front of the line. No way! Then we were given a free drink coupon for our flight. Beer, wine or liquor was valid for the day of travel only and only for Southwest Airline, this was rejected by attendant with "We haven't had alcoholic beverages for over two years now, then he chuckled". A non alcoholic beverage offering at that time would have been nice, but no offer. We had already had coffee and soda, so maybe one drink allowed. This is the worst experience ever flying. Why should I pay for business class if it does not benefit me. We boarded behind wheelchair passengers and their extended families who miraculously were able to travel walking when landed due to no wheelchairs available yet at the gate. Three of 9 remained seated waiting for assistance. I have no problem waiting for those three, at all. This makes me question if I will ever fly Southwest again, but I will never pay for Business Class again with them, regular boarding took well over 2 hours to check in for the flight. There were at least 5 counters to serve other class boarding. The security process took way less time as they screened everyone's bags and persons. This is an economy type airline, thankfully it was the non-stop destination option. Beware, if you fly with them, keep your money in your pocket and don't bother with A list, business or first class, you just threw away your money.

Southwest’s customer service is terrible. I paid for early bird check in, when I got to the airport my boarding number was C 47. I upgraded so I wouldn’t be the last one on the plane with the worst seat. So now this has cost $60 and Southwest refuses to give a reimbursement for their error. In Houston it took 45 minutes at baggage claim for the luggage. Overall I will not fly with them if this is how they do business. I am grateful my flight was canceled.

header: "If your not going to wear a mask properly the entire time don't fly!"
comment: Not Verified |  My comment is on the lack of enforcement of masks. Yes we say it's mandatory but they are not enforcing it properly. As soon as stewardesses walk away people pull mask down all the way or under nose. If your not going to wear a mask properly the entire time don't fly! Stewardesses should be more firm and walking around enforcing mask more. I flew from Texas to Ohio, girl took her mask down during snacks and didn't put it up the rest of the trip. My return flight the man beside me didn't even wear a mask into the airport and didn't wear it the entire trip even after being told multiple times by one step "thank God" to put it up and leave it up. This man after the second time should have been fined and or arrested upon departure. But no.. nobody says anything and how many people end up sick?

Kansas City to Denver. Horrible experience. Had a direct flight that was held an extra 30 minutes for 5 people to board from connecting flights - after everyone was already boarded. Once we reached Denver, there were no gates available so we waited in a long line of planes for over an hour. I don't understand how this could happen at Denver. It is huge. Never flying Southwest again.

This was the absolute worst experience of my entire life. I will never fly with southwest again. First of all, the flight attendant showed up super late causing the flight to be delayed. Once we were all boarded and sitting in the seats, the power went out on the plane. We waited and waited and finally it got fixed. Then we pulled onto the runway, and for some reason they pulled us all the way back up to the gate again! Nobody told us what was going on. So we sat at the gate for MORE than 30 minutes and we still don’t know why and then finally we went back to the runway and we took off. Then we landed here at CVG at 12:20am (many hours later than planned) and I'm still sitting here in this plane at 1:02am and they haven't let us off yet - why am I still sitting here in this plane 42 minutes after landing? Why did we not land until after midnight when I have work early in the morning? Because of stupidity. I am floored and very angry. They’ve lost a customer.

header: "No notification from the crew on board"
comment: Not Verified |  Flight was delayed 2.5 hours when there were planes on the ground not being used. Finally boarded and still delayed because waiting for 3 people that were running late. Landed very late then sat on the ground for another hour waiting for a plane to move from the gate. There were 5 open gates but they wouldn’t let us park there. Instead, we sat on the ground inhaling fumes. No notification from the crew on board as to why. This was mismanagement and someone high up made a small mistake which cascaded to a larger one.

This isn’t the first time Southwest has screwed up my luggage. Last time I flew southwest they lost my luggage, and then gave me the wrong luggage. This time they completely damaged my Delsey large luggage, it wasn’t a cheap purchase for me by any means. I understand normal wear and tear on luggage, but this went so far past wear and tear. Customer service does not help and will tell you to simply accept that they damage your property. The only thing that’s nice about Southwest is that their rates are budget but you make up the difference in having to buy new luggage. Fly American Airlines.

I left a package on my flight from Boston to Midway. It was an early Christmas gift with instructions not to open until Christmas. I accidentally left it in the above luggage compartment when I deplaned. I only remembered that I left it there when I boarded my flight from Midway to Houston Hobby. I completed a missing items report and spoke with a few flight attendants. They all directed me to fill out the mission items report. Before leaving the airport I stopped at the luggage office and the woman gave me the number to the lost and found offices in Midway and Pittsburgh (where the plane that I left the package on was going to next). I called both offices a few times and the next day a woman in Midway answered and said they had the package. I was so relieved. She offered to mail it to me and needed my FedEx number. I was having trouble with my FedEx account so I needed to hang up with her and then call her back. She was so wonderful and helpful. I can't remember if her name was Courtney or Michelle or something else. Any way, I was extremely grateful for your kindness and her help! Thank you, SW! and thank you in particular to them women in Hobby and Midway who were so helpful!

Not Verified | I had two flights with this airline - and both of them were direct. I purchased those flights because I have a tight timetable. One of them was at 6:55 in the morning after getting in late at night on another airline. The first flight was cancelled weeks before with NO reasonable rebook options, so I had to fly from MCI to Chicago before heading out west. This one was cancelled immediately beforehand, and then the woman at the counter told us to run, not telling us the gate was at the other end of the airport and not calling them to tell them to wait. After running, losing some of our stuff, I was treated to missing the plane anyway and then being changed to an even later flight on no sleep. Vouchers do not make this right. I won’t be flying Southwest again.

Not Verified | I had a travel voucher from a purchase in Feb 2021. I used them throughout this past year but had some travel voucher $ leftover. I then used that to roll into a new flight that was scheduled to take place in Dec 2021. I had to cancel that trip because I got covid the day before. When I went to use the travel voucher for a trip this Feb 2022, I saw that the two different travel voucher credits expiration dates were rolled up into the original Feb 2021 purchase instead of being separated out from dates or purchases. Very dissatisfied with this treatment. I called southwest to get it straightened out and waited on the phone for over 45 minutes only to hang up because I had to get to my appointment. Had I known I would have to go through all of this with the travel voucher expiration date problem from Southwest and waiting on the phone for help I would have gone with a different airline and airline credit card.

Not Verified |  They were very courteous, helpful and inviting. I had no issues. Everyone and everything from booking and boarding to baggage claim went smooth and I will Definitely continue to use them. 5 out of 5 stars!

header: "what happened at the basic premise of customer service"
comment: My half brother who is intellectually challenged asked for help in obtaining his boarding pass this morning at the Orlando (MCO) terminal for Southwest Airlines. He was there at 5:00 am for a 6:45 am flight. He forgot his mask. A Customer Assistant lady told him that he had to get out of line and possibly was going to be thrown out of the airport because he did not have a mask. This is after he politely told them that he forgot his mask and if they could get him a mask. He had to go and purchase a mask. Luckily there was a kind soul in line that provided him with a mask to wear. Needless to say he was petrified that he would miss his flight. Like I instructed him to ask for help with the kiosk to obtain his boarding pass. I have never had any problems in the many years I've flown Southwest Airlines or other airlines in my Air Force career spanning decades. The staff member told him that he had to get his own boarding pass, he had to do manage the kiosk by himself. Anyone that ever meets my half brother automatically is aware that he is intellectually challenged. First of all it is heartless to have this attitude toward intellectually challenged human beings. Secondly what happened at the basic premise of customer service for Southwest Airlines? Did I say heartless! What kind of training is this airline providing to their so called customer service representatives that are in the forefront of this airline? I called Southwest to file a formal complaint. It tells me where Southwest Airlines customer service initiatives are.

I left Cancun, Mexico, with a 45 minute lay over at Houston, before heading to my final destination (Phoenix). I got to Houston at 10am. My flight to Phoenix kept getting cancelled from 11:30 am till 6pm. Then Southwest Airlines load us on a flight to San Jose with promises that phoenix will be our last destination that day. The minutes we touched San Jose, we were told our flight to Phoenix was canceled. To top things off. My checked in bag got lost. Had no change of clothes. Southwest decided to put us in a hotel for a night. But did not pay for our meals. They issued new tickets showing from San Jose we would head to Phoenix the next day. Well, without any notice. At boarding time the next day, We were told the flight was going to another destination first. And we did. A trip that should have taken 4 hours took 28 hours. My bag with all my supplies got lost. Other customers bags were wet to the touch in San Jose. Southwest airlines did not see any need to explain why our flight was cancelled so many times. I'm done with this airline. Good luck to those who want to trust Southwest. I will pay and try my luck with better airlines.

Not Verified | We want to recognize a Southwest Airline Supervisor who helped us in the Orlando Airport on Dec. 1st. My husband had a low blood sugar episode while standing in line to board the plane. I notified the ticket agent who immediately called for a wheelchair. Ildi gave him some orange juice and sat with him while I spoke with another agent who called the paramedics. Ildi was very calm and supportive throughout the episode. She stayed with us the entire time, even after the paramedics checked his vitals. She was extremely professional. I just wanted to let the company know how much we appreciated her kindness and encouragement. She is an excellent representative for your company.

header: "I do not ever plan to use them again"
comment: Not Verified |  Southwest is known as a cheap airline, and it deserves this reputation. After waiting in line 25 minutes to add a Frequent Flyer number to my ticket, I was disconnected. It does not even allow you to leave a call back number. I do not ever plan to use them again.

Not the Southwest they were when they started. They used to talk the talk and walk the walk when it came to customer service, that no longer exists. Customer service is mediocre and incompetent. Processes that could be quick and streamlined easily take a lot of time. Not once were we verified for covid tests, mask wearing inside the aircraft is optional despite it being implemented by law. When you arrive at the Baltimore Airport you need to walk to the other end of the airport with your bags to do the bag transfer and wait in line for people coming into the airport. I can't imagine what that must be like for someone with some form of impediment like the lady I saw dragging her bag walking with a cane. Staff aren't as polite as they used to be either. We are definitely not flying with them again and changing our Chase card from SW to another airline.

Literally the worst airline with the worst customer service. Booked a flight for April 2020 but it was the peak of COVID pandemic and all travel had to be canceled. I was not given an option of refund, instead the money was put into my Southwest account for use within 1 year. I work in healthcare and it became nearly impossible to travel anywhere for the year. I tried to make a travel plan by December 2020 just to use the existing funds in my Southwest account but had to cancel last moment again due to increasing COVID cases around December 2020. Again the amount was put back into my Southwest account until it expired and now they’re are offering me a small voucher after all my flight money has been taken. I am so disgusted by the way they handled the refunds during the pandemic. I vow to never board Southwest ever again!

We arrived at 7:52 for an 8:00 flight and got rejected at the gate. Apparently, Southwest has a very strict policy of cutting off boarding 10 minutes before takeoff. We were 2 minutes past their cutoff but they had no mercy during the holiday season. I other airline I have flown will cut you off; if you make it before take off you are good. On top of that, the gate attendant was unkind and cold. I will never fly southwest again and I don’t recommend them to anyone. Silly policies and poor customer service.

Not Verified |  The stewards were so rude. We selected to sit by the door for leg room. They asked to respond verbally and my husband responded Si. She yelled at him saying in English! Really! Glared at us whole time. Seats were separated and when we asked is there a way we can sit together we were told to appreciate what we had. On the way back everyone seems grouchy or in a bad mood. Maybe they are over worked because so many lost jobs over vaccine mandates. But for whatever the reason I will never fly with Southwest again. Did not appreciate the treatment on a six hour flight going both ways.

Spoke with a reservation agent regarding booking a military flight for four round trip tickets on Dec 12 for Dec 24.-Jan 3.. Was told that paris would not need a seat so we proceeded to talk about purchasing three seats and were asked for our card details so it can be placed on file. After giving our details the gentleman made the purchase without any consent of the purchase being made at that moment or anything. My husband had to look at our account to see that money had been taken after asking the gentleman why would he not notify us he then proceeds to say that he never really took our son into account(put him in the system) and now he need to make a separate purchase because he infants does need a seat and that any 2 and up has to pay for a seat, although in a previous conversation he had said 2 and under. Not once did he apologize for charging our card without approval nor for neglecting to tell us our child did need a seat at the time of purchase when being told originally that he didn’t. We are in the holiday season when tickets can be pricey and I feel that we should’ve been given a option as to which airline would accommodate us better instead our money was taken and now we have to week 7-10 business days to get the money back and by then all the airline seats will be sold out or higher due to this inconvenience. I asked to speak with a supervisor and was switched to a department without briefing them of my case and without any notations being place on my account. And the Supervisor didn’t help either it was either get a refund or pay full price for my sons ticket(a seat that he will not sit in) no discount, no taxes dropped for making me have to do two purchases when being asked if 4 tickets needed to be purchased and/or no comped seat for the child. Completely unprofessional experience and I never intend to fly with this company again. There’s no respect for the customers and they don’t believe in satisfying the customers even when the customers are looking for a resolve.

Not Verified | I was flying from Houston to Florida and had a lay over in New Orleans. Lay over originally was 50mins but then flight got delayed. I land in Tampa and apparently me and several people who had similar lay overs all had luggage left back in New Orleans. The airline couldn't have bothered to transfer our bags on time?  There was ample time and they ruined a weekend trip i planned. Southwest, you need to get your act together and have better policies. Now we are all waiting to get our stuff back. I  will never travel Southwest again. This is just pure laziness and could have been avoided. Thanks for the $200 travel voucher.
I have been delayed 3 times on this flight. I was suppose to be in las Vegas at 4:45 pm. Not I’m barely about to board and it’s 6:20pm. This is terrible time management.

Not Verified | My husband and I recently flew Southwest Airlines coming home from a vacation trip. The Southwest Airlines steward, Lloyd, was so attentive and respectful. He offered walking and seat change assistance to an elderly woman on the plane. He also checked on all the passengers several times throughout the flight to make sure everyone was doing okay. Lloyd made the flight enjoyable and comfortable. I will definitely continue to fly with Southwest because of him.

Can’t believe the lack of EQ from Staff. Had to buy a last minute ticket for my 2 year old daughter and 5 year old son. Somehow the boarding passes were split up. So my son was A and me and my daughter were B. So we tried to board in the A group seeing as we would be called up in another 20 or so people. And the man taking tickets refused to let us do so. Very disgusted with his attitude, as he was treating us like shop lifters.

I flew with Southwest Airlines from San Francisco to LA! The flight had a delay of about 3 or 4 hours! The flight attendant gave all the passengers vouchers for about $100. The voucher expired by the end of 2020! The pandemic time! Everywhere was closed and some of the people didn’t feel safe to travel during that time! Now since everything is getting better I called the airline, I asked about extending my voucher, I explained everything, it was a pandemic for all the world not only California! They don’t do it! Why? Because they keep saying we have 6 months policy after the expiration date! It was a pandemic! Such a bad experience 4 hours delay (however this is not irregular for Southwest), no care about customers!

Booked fares to Stl from Hou. At midnight Oct 10, received a text saying flight was canceled and to log on to SW to rebook.....no flights available! Called CS and there was a recording stating there was a 120 minute wait. Got rental car to drive back to Hou. SW gives me a $150 voucher? Doesn’t cover even one fare, not to mention the car and fuel! Never again!

header: "pleasantly surprised that I felt okay even though it was chaotic"
comment: Not Verified |  My friend and I were trying to fly out of Los Angeles (Burbank) to NYC and of course the fog was crazy this particular morning. Burbank ended up canceling every flight (at least in the morning). The lady at one of the kiosks was super helpful. In a very stressful situation (for everyone) was cool, calm, and collected. She was kind and quick when helping us out. I was pleasantly surprised that I felt okay even though it was chaotic.

header: "I doubt I will fly Southwest again"
comment: We flew Southwest for family vacation to Cancun. We went from GR to Chicago and when boarding started they said first come first serve on seats and we were letter C so we're last to board. Some of us got to sit together to Chicago, once we boarded in Chicago to Cancun again first come first serve we were letter C again . My family was strong put through out the whole airplane . My son has a brain injury and didn't have a clue how to fill out the declaration papers. So you people need to start assigning seats. We all ended up in middle seats and were like sardines  .. for the money we paid should of got better service. No one wants to move or offer a seat because they want an empty seat between them. With my experience I doubt I will fly Southwest again.

header: "our first time ever flying Southwest and it will be our last"
comment: Not Verified |  This was our first time ever flying Southwest and it will be our last. Totally disorganized and for the price of our ticket it was a rip-off. We paid $1200 each plus upgraded once not realizing that people can sit in the same area without paying. This was from Nashville to Puerto Vallarta. I have traveled all over the world including on many foreign carriers and have never had an experience even close to this one. Beware!

Not Verified |  Southwest has been getting progressively worse. If I had a problem with one flight once in a while it would be fine, but every time I fly Southwest something happens. They damaged my brand new suitcase. 4 hr delay. 30 minute delay because their attendant was late. A very unprofessional airline. Many of the employees are pretty grumpy. Wouldn't recommend

Not Verified |  I had the most terrible experience flying with Southwest for the first time. First, I had to deal with security at Baltimore airport, who shook me down over a bottle of hair cream and because of the sparkles on my sweater and missed my first flight, then I was placed on a later flight with Southwest, waiting to get back home to Florida, but waited an entire hour at the airport, due to the flight being delayed and the Southwest staff failing to update us on why we were an hour late leaving the airport. When an explanation was finally provided, we were told that our plane had to be towed, which made no sense, then we were told that we were unable to board, due to a technical issue with the computers. So, we were dealing with a huge, tired and confused group of people, waiting around in the airport, just waiting to go home. Oh and the saga doesn't end there, once we were FINALLY able to board the plane, we had to wait an additional 30 minutes, for no reason. I don't think I will ever fly with Southwest again, I didn't get back to Florida until 10:30pm and still had to drive 45 minutes to where I actually live, from West Palm Beach.

Not Verified |  Overall, my flight was great. We arrived just in time for boarding, and it was quick and fast. Taxing was surprisingly quick.  Entertainment was easy, you could bring your own handheld device. The website offered a ok selection of movies and tv shows, along with free messaging (iMessage and WhatsApp). Internet costs 8$, but free for A-List Preferred members I believe. Lastly, they had a good selection of Live TV stations and free Iheartradio. The seat width was good for a 2 hour flight, however one concern I would have is food. They only offer a snack mix on the airline, however they do offer a selection of beverages. If you are going on a longer flight, please bring your own food. The landing provided scenic views of the Hoover Dam, the touchdown was a little bumpy. I would recommend Southwest if you want a great experience and cheap fares. And I forgot to mention, be sure to take advantage of their free baggage system! (first 2 bags free)

Worst experience flying with Southwest. First they cancel your flight, then the process to rebook is a headache, also don’t forget after they rebook us from our original itinerary to San Diego I have to land at Ontario and have someone drive 4 hours (there and back) to pick me up. Also my luggage is on a completely different flight. Not only that but my other friend is given false tickets since she was left in Long Beach instead of lay over in Oakland and land in San Diego. She lands in Long Beach without luggage as well.

SWA Canceled our flight to Vegas 3 hrs before take off (6:30am) via text 11/1/21. We were advised to jump online to re-book, by the time we did there were no flights available. We were meeting friends, pre-paid hotel, had Lionel Ritchie tickets and this was a vacation we had planned 10 months in advance. We never got to go because other airlines same day booking were astronomically high. We missed our concert, vacation and friends because of SWA employee no shows, this was the reason for cancellation. We complained to SWA and their response was a $150 voucher, after losing out over $1500 in hotel fees and concert tickets. Beware of this airline trying to make amends at faults of their own. Their customer relations dept are horrible and would not recommend flying with them ever.

header: "No one knew what was going on"
comment: Absolutely the worst experience I’ve ever had at an airport/with an airline. We got to the airport at 1pm for a 4.35pm departure. We were moved to 3 different lines and eventually at 3.0pm we reached the ticket counter. When we reached the front of the line they then took people behind us that were on a flight that departed 10 minutes before ours. No one knew what was going on and the extra time we wanted to use to get food and other items was now gone and we had to rush to our gate.

header: "We could not be happier with the care and help"
comment: Not Verified |  Our flight from Albany to San Antonio on Southwest had us worried after the problems of cancelled flights a few weeks earlier. Also this was our first try at bringing a folding electric wheelchair for use at our destination as well as during the layovers. We could not be happier with the care and help with getting the chair aboard the plane and retrieving it at each destination. The personnel at the check in and the gates at Albany, Baltimore, and San Antonio, were superb. I would recommend Southwest to any traveler and especially passengers that need assistance. Southwest people are the best.
route: Albany NY to San Antonio TX via Baltimore MD

comment: Not Verified |  This has been the worst experience I've ever had with an airline, so many delays. Now I'm on a 2 hour delay from Dallas to Indianapolis and I won't get home until after midnight - unacceptable.

header: "lousy way to end a family trip"
comment: Not Verified |  Continuing saga. After a three plus hour delay at John Wayne Airport and a thirty-six minute flight we get to spend another three hour plus wait in the McCarran airport since the delay caused us to miss our flight to Reno. They assigned us to group C boarding yet we had paid the upgrade to A boarding. When questioned they just said they'll refund our money. A lousy way to end a family trip to Disneyland. With the delay to fly down and back we could have driven and saved the sore arse, back and frustration. JSX or AHA here we come.

I have never had such a terrible experience. Multiple delays, missed connections and rude staff. After paying for early boarding, we were bumped down to the C boarding group due to a three hour delay causing us to miss our connection. We phoned Southwest from the airport and they refused to help us. We even asked if we could pay more to be part of group A-15. Due to Southwest issues, I was not able to even sit with my husband. As they say at Southwest “C is for the center seat”. We will never fly Southwest again. We could have driven in half the time it took us to fly. This was not a budget flight paying $450 each for for the trip. Never again!
route: Reno to Orange county via Las Vegas

header: "they fail to live up to any form of arriving or departing on time"
comment: Not Verified |  I've flown this airline three times and each time there has been a delay of two to three hours each. Often for no reason of why. I've no problem with the crew but have grievous trepidations about the airline organization itself. They claim low cost which is true but they fail to live up to any form of arriving or departing on time. This will be an airline of last resort. Fly at your own risk especially if there is a connecting flight.
route: Reno to John Wayne via Las Vegas

comment: As I am writing the review now, when my flight is supposed to be already in air and should have been reaching Nashville in an hour. But, I am still sitting with full house flight still at LaGuardia since 6:55pm. And the pilot is waiting for the gas in the flight as we speak! This is very unprofessional. If someone actually have an emergency, I would not suggest Southwest Airlines to anyone.

Not Verified |  I called customer service before my flight because I was nervous about traveling with my wedding dress. She assured me I could just ask for help from the flight attendants with my dress to make sure it doesn’t get squished in the overhead bin. When I boarded, I asked the flight attendant at the front for help and he laughed at me and told me there’s nothing they can do to help me, and then when I got by the seat I chose, I asked another flight attendant for help and she said the same thing. Horrible experience. They didn’t even act like they cared about getting my expensive wedding dress to my wedding safely. I’m very annoyed and won’t be flying with them again.

The lady announced for active duty service member to board along with handicap personnel and when I went to board the other lady stated that I cannot board as an active duty service member unless I'm in uniform. She stated "I already told you you cannot board active duty military if you are not in uniform". The Navy is not even allowed to travel I'm any uniform but dress uniform via commercial plane. She was very rude and disrespectful, she rolled her eyes and said under her breath something about "privileged".

Not Verified |  I fly domestically and internationally a great deal and use Southwest to get from Sacramento to LAX for international connections and to Orange County to visit family. One of the flight attendants from Sacramento to Burbank was rude and dismissive and actually embarrassed one traveler in front of the rest of us. At Burbank today on the flight back to Sacramento, I went to the counter to pay for a better seating position and the attendant was rude and dismissive. Is this a new policy on the part of Southwest? I have been flying for 65 years all over the world and most other airlines go out of their way to be kind, welcoming and make your journey the most positive experience possible. Why not Southwest?

header: "the worst experience I have ever had flying"
comment: Not Verified |  Absolutely the worst experience I have ever had flying! After about an hour on route they tell us there is an electrical issue with the plane so we turn back around! Sounds harmless yet already very much inconvenient! Afterwards they take an additional 3 hours to rebook us on another flight that took another 2 hours to get "gassed", then proceeded to tell me that if I miss my connecting flight it is my fault! I will never fly with Southwest again!

header: "Southwest left us with no options and they didn’t care"
comment: Never have I ever been so poorly treated by Southwest Airlines. My husband and myself were supposed to leave Las Vegas headed back to Indianapolis on Monday Nov 1st at 6am. Instead we got a late email at 7pm October 30, informing us that are flight is cancelled and we won’t be able to fly out until the next day at 9.40 with a layover. Southwest refused to accommodate us with a hotel, food nor a different flight to a city close to Indianapolis. We had just found out we lost our grandmother and couldn’t get home. Instead they offered a 100 love flight voucher as if that would cover another night at the Aria or food and drinks for another full day stay. We had to miss an extra day of work and had to pay an extra day of child care because we had no other way of getting to our children. No way of getting to our family when they needed us the most. Southwest left us with no options and they didn’t care. The service coordinators were unhelpful, I’ve never been so poorly treated in my life. I’d never recommend anyone to fly them ever again. You all should be a ashamed of yourselves.

header: "I used to gladly fly SWA - now it has become my last resort"
comment: Not Verified |  SWA used to be a “cool”, fun airline. On time performance, top notch flight attendants, good planes. Whatever it is that has happened in the past year or so, the service is worse than UA and AA. The flight attendants are very surly. On time device is miserable and the planes are looking very tired. I used to gladly fly SWA - now it has become my last resort.

Not Verified |  Flew into Denver from Dallas, headed to Reno. For the second time in a row the flight was changed to another gate. This time the flight was delayed due to awaiting another aircraft to arrive then waiting another half hour for baggage to arrive from another flight. I made it home one hour late due to SW taking care of 5 customers instead of the others on the full flight. Bye SW. I'm going with American next flight. Choosing dollars over customers is not my type of business to do business.

Southwest has been horrible. For work, I flew from Las Vegas to Dallas for a connecting flight and was suppose to fly to Tampa. The connecting flight got canceled due to "weather" which Southwest lied. I was stuck in Dallas airport for two days without any luggage. Southwest could not get me back to Tampa so I had to fly to Atlanta and rent a car for $569.00 to drive back to Tampa. In the process, my Macbook screen was shattered by Southwest and it was in my luggage. Southwest denied the claim because it was past the four hours and they do not do claims on "electronic equipment". I couldn't report the damage within four hours because my luggage made it to Tampa without me since Southwest could not get me home. On top of everything, my zipper was broken, lock cut off my suite case and laptop screen broken. Southwest maintained it was "weather related" even though no other airline canceled their flights. This trip with Southwest has caused many issues and I will make sure my organization will not use them again.
route: La Vegas to Tampa via Dallas

header: "delivers when flying in and out of Reno"
comment: Not Verified |  Reno-Los Angeles via San Jose, Los Angeles-Reno. As always Southwest is great flying out of Reno. On time and friendly service. Two of the three flights were on a 737-700 but one leg had the 737-800 max. I really liked the max. For the most part almost new, very clean and good leg space. The flights were pretty uneventful which is fine with me. Standard beverage service and bag of pretzels. The return flight out of Los Angeles was a half hour delayed due to weather so really can't complain about that. No beverage service on that flight as turbulence was predicted because of flying through a storm but it never really materialized. Had my own drink and snacks that I brought so no problem. All in all Southwest always delivers when flying in and out of Reno.

header: "not recommend purchasing the early bird check-in"
comment: Not Verified |  When Southwest Airlines first came out with the early bird special to purchase for early check-in, I thought it was a great idea. However, it sucks or is a scam. Seven times out of seven, I got in the worse boarding positions; only the very first time was I in "A" boarding category. My boarding positions were as follows (when I used the early bird check-in): A36, B15, B22, C1, B7, C10, B30. I will no longer purchase the early bird special. as it (clearly) does not check you in early for good boarding positions. Oh, as a side note, the last 3 check-ins I did without the early bird special, when I did it myself, my boarding positions were: A5, A8, A12. In case nobody knows, seat are not assigned, just boarding positions. So when they announce that they are boarding "A" passengers to board the plane, then A1-A36 passengers enter the plane first and get the pick of the seat, then B1-B36 and then C1-36. So you can imagine how bad the seats left over were, if you're in the "B" and especially the "C' categories. Don't buy the early bird special, it's not worth the extra money, especially when they cannot even guarantee that you'll be in the "A" category at all. I would recommend the airline because it's usually inexpensive, but I would not recommend purchasing the early bird check-in service, because it sucks, or is a scam for additional for nothing!

Not Verified |  My entire plan was derailed because of airline staffing and delays. In the end I was instead flown to LAX and unable to secure transportation without spending 4xs what I had planned to because of the inconvenience. I believe it's fair to have the expectation that companies provide the service that you purchase on time. Safety issues I might understand but poor planning isn't acceptable. Use a different carrier ... bags fly free but you and your bags may to tardy for the party.

Worst experience on an airplane ever. I had been flying Southwest loyally for over 10 years. Today we had a flight from Hartford to Baltimore get delayed. In Baltimore I had a connecting flight to Sarasota. I asked the gate attendant if we would be in jeopardy of missing our connection to Sarasota. She said no that flight was also delayed. We arrived in the A wing , ran frantically to the B wing to make our connection. Myself and over 10 other passengers found the door to board closed, plane still there and we were denied access to the plane. Without our knowledge, Southwest changed our flights to a later flight without ever notified us all. They refused to let all of us on the plane that was still sitting there. I paid extra to be in the A group for priority boarding, but my reissued ticket has us in the C group, last people to board. When asked the attendant said it would cost an additional $40. I already paid the $40 on my original ticket and I know from past experience that whenever I changed my reservation I never lost my A status. Because Southwest made the changes, that did not happen. I will never fly them again. Thank you Southwest for sticking a loyal customer in the back of the plane. You denied us all access to our original flight, delayed our original flight, changed our reservation without our notice and stuck us in the back of the plane. Keep your travel voucher Southwest. You mistreated many customers today. I will try your new competitor Avelo which is actually cheaper or Jet Blue from now on. I am also going to cancel my Southwest credit card as you do not value my time and me as a customer.

I have now contacted Southwest 3 times with no satisfaction. Five members of my family were stranded in Chicago on their way to Florida due to canceled flights. After 3 days a family member drove to Chicago, 4 hours away to pick them up. Their luggage was returned 10 days later. The compensation for that was 1 $150 voucher. In a response to the canceled flights, the response was basically, it’s not our problem. They were out over $1000 in hotel and food bills plus the cost of loss time for someone to pick them up. Southwest sent a $150 voucher. I guess 5 people are supposed to split that. I am very disappointed with Southwest and their lack of consideration for the people who make this airplane profitable!

Terrible business model, if you reserve a flight six months in advance then cancel within a week you cannot get a refund, you are instead offered a credit which can be used to purchase another flight through Southwest Airlines, but only within the next 12 months. You are required to pay a higher price for a ticket to get a refund just in case you need to cancel the flight to actually get your money back.

Not Verified |  Due to Covid nonsense when we booked a flight in January 2020 we had to cancel. We are getting married Nov 19 2021 and wanted to use our credit to fly for our honeymoon leaving Nov 23rd 2021 and the customer service is so unfair, that she states it expires on Nov 15th and that we can do our honeymoon before the wedding! So basically there’s nothing they can do for us.

header: "extremely weary of being treated like cattle"
comment: Not Verified |  I have flown Southwest for several years but currently looking at other options. The service, dependability, and customer service of the past has dramatically changed and not for the better. I just returned yesterday on a flight from Texas. It is not possible as evidenced by passengers exiting the flight and the time at which passengers are then boarded for cleaning and sanitizing to be completed per their stated protocol. That, and the discarded wrappers in the seat pockets, as well as a sticky substance, splashed on the back of the seat in front of me further validates this. In addition, I have definitely had it with checking in at the very moment possible only to board and find passengers who've already boarded saving seats for others further back in the boarding process, while flight attendants who are very obviously aware do not enforce their own boarding practice. I am extremely weary of being treated like cattle. Most airlines have already eliminated the change fees, the only other perk that Southwest offers that others do not is 2 free checked bags, but even that is barely worth it anymore. I expect that other airlines will soon follow suit, and when that happens, it will be the end of Southwest if they do not improve their current practices. I applied for, and have received the chase sapphire card which will allow me to accrue points that can be used for any of the airlines. In the meantime, I am looking at baggage shipping services as a way to deal with the baggage fees.

header: "Your staff were amazing and so very nice!"
comment: This is to the actual employees who were there and not your CEO who I find a big fat liar! Southwest employees, I know you had some problems weekend before last. I just want to say that my flights on the 15th from Reno to LAX and 16th from LAX to El Paso went so wonderfully. I was traveling with my 1 yr old granddaughter. You guys made it so much easier with her. We were running late due to extra time at security and you actually held up for us while we ran across the terminal. Your staff were amazing and so very nice! Thank you for that! I know times aren’t easy and your working while fighting for your own rights and freedoms, so I just want to say thank you for all your help. We will see you on our flights back the 1st and 2nd of November!

Still sitting in the airplane 2 hours after boarding. First hold up was supposedly because extra maintenance checks had to be done for over an clean flights. Second hold up was for weight and balance issues. They were literally moving 5 people around the plane and there were only 10 empty seats total. Then as we are pushing back from the gate the pilot comes on and says he is out of hours. We were 10 ft from the gate and he pulled back up and got off. 20 minutes later a new captain comes on and basically has to start all over. Just got word that they were topping off the gas. How is it you have to top off the gas if we were pushing from the gate 45 minutes ago. Southwest really needs to look at their management and processes. This is definitely a 1 star flight.
route: Baltimore to Honolulu via Las Vegas

comment: I cannot believe I trusted Southwest with a short flight. I am beyond frustrated at being delayed twice and hearing multiple people also have experienced this multiple times from Southwest. As an airline company, the one thing to get right is being able to adhere to scheduled times. There are many people who rely on flight times for all sorts of events. I will never fly Southwest again.

I’ll never fly Southwest again. Booked a flight from Austin to Ontario and had a connection flight in Phoenix. The flight from Austin to Phoenix was delayed an hour and a half. Southwest then rebooked my flight from Phoenix to Ontario on another flight since the delay of the first flight was set to have me miss my original plane out of Phoenix. My original plane I was in group A. Southwest rebooked me and put me in group C as the last person on the plane. I mentioned that I was forced to this plane due to the airline’s own delay and was originally in group A, asking if I could get the same group for the new flight. The airline rep told me I “could if I pay for it.” What terrible customer service. Thanks for the delayed flight and then having me be the last person on the plane with the worst choice in seating on a full flight. You guys screwed up, yet I’m the one that gets the short end of the stick. Didn’t offer any kind of compensation/voucher, was rude, and Not trying to make right on their mistake. I will never use Southwest again. Worst airline ever.

I purchased my ticket the night before my flight (San Diego to Phoenix). After all the cancellations I felt this was a bad idea, but it’s a 1 hour flight. What could go wrong? Multiple delays. Insane. Southwest wants to keep pocketing money and cancelling flights. Total joke. Will never fly with these clowns again. Thanks for allowing me to be late for my sisters wedding, Southwest. Especially when I could have just made the 5hr drive.

header: "What used to be a reputable airline is becoming a joke"
comment: 3 for 3 in last two months with being late on departure! What used to be a reputable airline is becoming a joke! I booked my flight for Christmas, and it wasn't on Southwest! They are right up there with Spirit Airlines.

Not Verified |  First of all, they cancelled my flight at the last minute, then rescheduled me to a flight with little to no time to react...a flight that took me from Dallas to Nashville to Denver, arriving at 11:45 pm. Ridiculous. We are die hard SWA customers, but we have just about had it. Get your act together SWA!

header: "Finally hung up and drove rental to destination"
comment: Not Verified |  Horrible experience, canceled flight and told me to change my reservation. Attempted, but no flights available. Attempted to call and put on hold for almost 4 hours. Finally hung up and drove rental to destination.
route: Las Vegas to Dallas Love Field

header: "this latest experience was not pleasing at all"
comment: Not Verified |  I have been a long-time customer of Southwest Airlines, beyond satisfied, however, this latest experience was not pleasing at all. I made a reservation to visit my daughter in Los Angeles, CA for the 1st of September (Wednesday). She called me and said not come as she had tested positive for COVID. I immediately cancelled my reservations (Tuesday August 31st) and received a notification that they had been cancelled and the funds would remain for any future flights. That was 8/31/21. I got another email a few days later stating that my reservation had not been done in a timely manner, and that my funds were taken and I would not get a refund and/or credit. I called SWA Customer Service to dispute this and was not given any consideration. I’m 70 years old, on a fixed income and was not pleased with the outcome. I would hate to stop flying SWA, however (I‘ve worked in customer service for over 40 years), and would appreciate being given some satisfaction in this matter.

Not Verified |  We have flown southwest for many years and have been very satisfied with their service in general. Just this past Sunday, oct. 10th we experienced the first cancellation ever. They were able to rescheduled my husband for a flight out the next day at 10:35am. He had a confirmed doctor's appointment and was able to make it. Not only did southwest rebook him and he made the appointment, but the also worke with him during the process and gave him a voucher for the inconvenience. Once again Southwest did their fine job. I just hope they resolve whatever issues they have and continue to fly safe and on time as they have always done.

Not Verified |  This was the second leg of the trip - ORD/DAL/HOU (Flt 29). Full flight with open seating. The flight attendant who was standing at the forward galley as boarding was almost completed started singing - while her voice was/is good, it is not great. After serenading us, she then began to what amounted to a lecture on how we are all blessed and asked to the passengers to respond in the affirmative. In addition, we were told we were all loved, etc. It had the feel and sound of an evangelical Christian bible meeting. Several passengers passengers around me were shaking their heads in disgust while others were yelling "Praise Jesus". Unprofessional, insulting and narcissistic for her to think that we would want to hear her sing or preach. In addition, there is no service of any kind on the DAL/HOU/DAL leg. I do not understand why Southwest is popular - this is nothing more than a bus with wings. I will never purchase a ticket on WN or recommend them. I will stick to the legacy carriers such as American, etc.

Southwest has canceled my flight two times already. They don't send an email out until midnight. Wait times are crazy. Over 3 hours. Me and my family are stuck in Houston Texas and it has cost us over 1000 just for two days. We had to pay for hotel fees and rental car fees at the last minute due to southwest flight cancelation. We weren't offered any type of accommodations, only to rebook and when we do it gets canceled again at midnight.

Not Verified |  Never ever flying Southwest again. They cancelled our flight last minute and we were told they can’t fly us home until two days later. When we asked for a hotel they said “all of our hotels are booked.” I demanded to speak with the manager who took 30 mins to come talk to us and acted like it was a big deal to get us a hotel. This airline refused to give us a credit to fly home today through another airline. We asked if they could fly us to somewhere near our home and they simply said “we don’t have anything.” Worst experience and ruined our vacation. Not only did we have to call off of work but we had to spend extra money for food and ubers.

Not Verified |  We had been waiting in line to board the plane for about 15 minutes, the flight attendants were just standing there telling us nothing about what was going on! I kid you not, while in line to board the plane, they cancelled the flight! While we were in line to get on that flight. Even worse, they had already boarded our luggage on the plane and they wouldn’t un-board it! My family was stuck there for HOURS trying to figure out what to do. We ended up having to go on a train for 12 hours and picking up our luggage the next day from the flight they wouldn’t let us on. They flew the luggage but not the people. Apparently the day before our flight a bunch of air control people quit because of the vaccine requirements. There was no reason they couldn’t have cancelled the flight the day before it was supposed to take off. Worse, they won’t give us a refund! They’re offering us credits but we will never be flying with them again.

header: "Southwest has quickly become the worst airline"
comment: Southwest has quickly become the worst airline. My last two flights I have booked a non stop flight to Phoenix and both times they have switched my flights to having one or two stops. This particular time I received an email at 1am stating my flight has been canceled for no reason. My wife has been on the phone for more then 9 hrs trying to talk to a representative and still no one has answered. At this time news outlets has stated that due to weather and air traffic control was the issue, so I drive to the airport and asked myself. They stated is was due to staffing issues? Why wouldn't they know that at 9pm when I last checked the flight status? When I talked to the ticket agent I was greeted with condescending answers and a attitude. Thanks again Southwest! So they rescheduled my flight - I now leave Tuesday, I have lost 2 days of my vacation, my rental car, and my time from work. As someone who works with the public my time is limited and for Southwest to show no remorse in their actions to help me. I will never fly Southwest again!

Horrible customer service. Flight was canceled twelve hours before flight. No flights for two days! Call and they can’t even pick up the phone. I have been a customer for many years and can now say I will never fly Southwest again. Would not recommend this airline.
Worst Airline on the planet, customer service is horrible, rude people. Had me on hold on the phone for almost 4 hours. I’m beyond furious. Never again Southwest Airlines.

header: "Never will I use Southwest Ever Again"
comment: Not Verified |  Got a text my flight was canceled with a link to reschedule - went to link and no flights available for 2 days. I do not have medication with me for 2 more days. In a hotel where the bill for two more days will be more than the flight. Meanwhile I have been on hold since 1:05 am and it is now 6:04. Never Have I Experienced with such Irresponsibility. Never will I use Southwest Ever Again.

Not Verified |  Return flight scheduled for 10/9/2021 250. App notification flight delay approximately 1hr. Flight was cancelled. Notified to go to ticket counter. Waiting in line at ticket counter notified had to pickup luggage first prior to obtaining new flight, must retrieve my luggage first. So lost my place in line in order to get my luggage. My luggage came off last thus placing me at the end of line. Look on their website and there are no reservations available for the next day. So made reservations for the next day out of another airport. While holding on the phone. Was on hold over 8 hrs. Thought my reservations for the next day were confirmed. They totally changed my reservations to 2 days after confirmation was received. So again I’m on hold and I should be up in a few hours for what I thought was my new reservation. This is horrible customer service. I am so dissatisfied. What a waste of time and money.

Not Verified |  Oct 9, 2021 flight #2451 departing at 5pm got canceled 3hrs before departure time Re-booked for 8:30pm flight# 1729 and 3 hours before departure time they send a message the flight was canceled too! Customer service are the worse. Very unreliable airline. Will never fly Southwest in my life!

We booked a round trip flight between Miami and Denver for our Denver vacation. The only reason we booked Southwest was for the nonstop flights. Both flights were cancelled within 30 minutes of the scheduled takeoff. The Miami to Denver flight was rescheduled with a layover, and the Denver to Miami was simply cancelled. Will never fly Southwest again; will never recommend Southwest. Thankfully they provided us with flight vouchers which we will happily never use. Southwest simply isn’t reliable. Do not book if you actually want to get where you are going.

Flight from Charleston South Carolina to St. Louis was cancelled at the last minute. Was never told why. The lack of information afterwards was completely unacceptable. Could not get anyone to tell us where to get our luggage as it had already been checked. Finally found our luggage at the carousel with no announcement. Will not fly Southwest again.

Not Verified |  No issues from Jacksonville to Houston Hobby, but upon landing I received a text notification my flight to Oklahoma City has been canceled. Agent explained weather has affected flight coming out of Florida. Strange since I also flew out of Florida. She couldn’t get me into OKC until around 10.30 pm via Denver. My flight was scheduled to be in OKC about 12.30 pm. She could however get me to Tulsa earlier. What? I would be on my own from Tulsa. I had no option but to accepted the OKC via Denver route. At 12.25 pm I received a text notification the Denver flight had been canceled. Good grief! Now I’m on a 9.05 pm flight to OKC. Never an offer for any type of financial consideration or compensation even though I asked if SW would cover the rental car cost in Tulsa to get me to OKC. Pitiful customer service! Today, I would not recommend SW due to their lack of excellent customer service and uncaring attitude of ticket counter rep.
route: Jacksonville to Oklahoma City via Houston Hobby

comment: What has happened to Southwest? I used to love them and tell everyone to use them. Other than one international flight, I have been 100% loyal to them for 18 years. Now I am furious with them. I will be canceling my SWA credit cards, and they have lost me as a loyal customer. The last 10 flights I have been on have been delayed or canceled. And of course, no concessions for the customer. "Full Service" desk had 2 attendants and over 100 customers. Over an hour of waiting and I am not pleased. It's time to find a new carrier.
route: Boise to Orlando via Las Vegas

comment: Southwest canceled our flight 14 hours before takeoff. Then re booked us 3 days later! Online site kept giving error to try to rebook. Stayed on hold for 2 hours and then got disconnected. Now all flights full. Had to cancel flights and refund will take at least 30 days. Now having to rent car and drive 22 hours. Will actually cost more with rental, gas, hotel stay, and we lose a day on our house rental plus extra night hotel to come home. Just so very frustrating to have booked flights months ago. Horrible customer service, horrible online process. I will never fly Southwest again!

header: "deeply disappointed in what was once America’s best domestic carrier"
comment: Southwest counter staff were rude, arrogant and appeared genuinely uninterested in our situation. We arrived at the airport 3 hours prior to departure to find no available airport parking, the shuttle from the Park-n-Fly dropped us at the wrong terminal, and security was severely backed up. We arrived at the gate 10 mins before departure and they had just closed the door. With both of us out of breath from running, my wife pleaded with them to let us board. The “Customer Service Supervisor” (Gate 10) appeared to relish her authority in refusing to open the door and let us board. She then spent a solid 30 minutes booking us on a flight for the following day. I explained that I could see same day flights available via the SW app and only then did she rebook me on a better itinerary. This is the 2nd bad experience on SW in the past 2 months and pre-Covid, I was an A-List flyer on SW. I’m deeply disappointed in what was once America’s best domestic carrier.

header: "Why am I paying the extra $90-130 for business class?"
comment: Not Verified |  I am an A list passenger with SW. I purchase the business class for quicker boarding, to insure I’m at the front. More and more these days, people are boarding during the pre-board segment I have noticed. This flight, there are 16 people, with 4 wheelchairs amongst them. That's more people than business class. I think SW should be vetting the pre-board people a little closer. Why am I paying the extra $90-130 for business class?

I have been flying a lot as of lately and 9/10 the flights have been delayed! Air conditioning has not been turned on while sitting on a crowded flight, beverages not offered, it is very disappointing. Unfortunately, this is one of the few airlines that flies into the small airport I need to use but I will not fly Southwest if other airlines are an option!!!

Not Verified |  Late for no reason. Kept changing the departure time and never told us what was going on or why. After boarding we just sat there for 30 min. No announcement - nothing. Baggage staff took their sweet time putting the bags under the plane, had zero sense of urgency. I had an appointment that I had over an hour and a half of leeway to get to. Thanks. I missed it. I will never fly this airline again.
route: El Paso to San Antonio via Dallas Love Field

comment: I have liked flying Southwest until this trip. Our first suitcase came out open, yes unzipped along with many others where you could see the clothing inside, and ours was also cut in an 'L' shape. I left my husband and daughter while I went to file a claim. No one was in the baggage service area and when I went to enter to call out another SW employee told me not to enter. Showed this SW employee my issue and she told me to wait the lady would 'know' I was there. I asked how she would know as this person had not notified anyone, there was no doorbell or cameras. She replied the lady would just know. A psychic I guess. While waiting my daughter called hysterical as her lacrosse sticks had not come out with her teammates and the conveyor belt had stopped. When we found it that person was rude as well and stated all sticks come out at over-sized baggage and we should have known that. Guess they forgot to tell our team as all the rest of the lacrosse sticks in lacrosse stick bags like hers did and have never before or again come out in over-sized baggage. Hers was the only stick bag to come out at over-sized luggage and only that one time. When the baggage service lady finally showed up, the two SW employees had to converse first about how I was waiting and not happy, making me wait even longer. When she did finally come over she refused, not once, but several times to fill out a ticket on my issue. She said open and cut luggage was not a valid claim. She outright refused to do anything. It gets better folks, I called SW and was being on hold a very long time. Finally, someone gets on the phone listens to my issues and than proceeded to tell me the people were not SW employees, but employees of BWI and I had to make a claim with BWI. When I pointed out all the employees I was calling about all wore SW uniforms she proceeded to enter my complaint about their rude customer service, but told me I had to do my own for the luggage. I did per her instructions. SW responded to the rude complainant with a letter stating they were sorry I was inconvenienced with a delay in my flight and offered me a SW credit. The luggage complaint they noted as complete without any letter, conversation, funds for new luggage or anything. I filed another complaint to comment on this incorrect form letter and the luggage issue to hear nothing from SW as it is now September with no reply.

header: "had left my phone on the plane"
comment: I trusted Southwest until a flight from Love Field to BWI September 16 2021 arriving 11:15 PM. Within five minutes of deplaning I realized I had left my phone on the plane. Unfortunately I had left the secure area so I could not return to Gate A 10 where the plane was located. I was directed by Southwest personnel to go to the baggage claim office to receive assistance. The three workers at baggage claim were admittedly dealing with a disgruntled employee and stated they could not help me at the time because they were "too busy". In fact the supervisor reprimanded me for leaving the phone on the plane and claimed it was my own fault for being so stupid. Despite resistance I insisted that a missing item claim be filed at the office before I departed the airport. I waited at baggage claim until 2:00 AM when an employee reportedly searched the plane only to find no cell phone. When I obtained access to my computer at 3:00 AM that morning I searched FIND MY PHONE, to discover my phone located at the Southwest baggage claim. I returned to the Southwest baggage claim the next morning and I showed them on my computer where my phone was located according to FIND MY PHONE. They told me they did not have my phone and that they could not help me. I then went to the police. They accompanied me to the SOUTHWEST baggage claim. He told me to stay outside the office and push my phone to ring on the FIND MY PHONE app, which I did. The police came out of the office and told me that my phone was in the office. When I went into the office to get my phone one employee verbally attacked me with comments such as "you were the irresponsible one who lost your phone" . Furthermore they justified themselves that their job was baggage claim, not lost and found? They would not verify to me where or when the phone had been found.

Not Verified |  Southwest cancelled 2 of my flights in the last month just hours prior to the flight leaving. They blame it on weather. United had no trouble taking us as we had to pay through the nose to fly last minute. I used to sing their praises, not any more. Cost me a small fortune. Cancelling their credit card and never flying them again. Use them if you don't need to get where you are on time or when you want. Hopefully the competition will put them out of business.

header: "What's the point of paying premium money"
comment: I flew with my 11 year old who is on the spectrum takes ADHD medicine and has anxiety! When a gate attendant allowed us to pre-board, another one, right at the time of entry said we shouldn't be pre-boarding and kind of implied that we are abusing the pre-boarding option! Second time from Seattle to Nashville I bought 3 premium tickets and was among the first 5 to board, then I was told that I am carrying more luggage on myself and should consolidate between my son, my mother, who has shoulder pain! What's the point of paying premium money when you have to take their hassle.

Not Verified |  Terrible. Flew my daughter home for a very short visit. Allowed over an hour between connecting flights. Flight out of Portland was delayed over an hour, and instead of holding the connecting flight for 10 minutes, they made everyone take another flight. Now my daughter has to take two more flights to get here, and will be arriving five hours (maybe) late! That's if the other flights are on time! This has happened too many times with Southwest. I have always loved them, but they have clearly gone way downhill. You can no longer count on leaving or arriving when scheduled. I am canceling my credit card with SW and going to a different airline.
route: Portland, OR to San Antonio, TX via Las Vegas

header: "would not let me on the plane"
comment: My flight was supposed to leave out of Gate 12 at 7:40 PM flying tonight from San Diego to Reno. At exactly 710 my flight had not boarded and I went to see what the matter was. Apparently they change the gate to a separate terminal without notifying me. I ran to gate eight and made it there by 7:30 PM on the dot plane was already boarded and they would not let me on the plane. Southwest reps did not display any compassion nor help me find a solution. I feel Southwest could’ve done a better job at resolving the matter. Especially since I arrived at The gate a full 10 minutes before it was even supposed to leave. not fair.

header: "it’s not fair to us loyal customers"
comment: Not Verified |  I have flown SW for over 10 years faithfully. This trip from Aruba on 9-5-21 was the worst flight attendants ever. None of them looked like they wanted to be at work yesterday. The plane wasn’t even full and they only offered drinks once on a four hour flight. I’m also amazed how many people get early boarding since most of the huge adults walked down the jet way without assistance. As someone who always pays extra to get a A seating assignment it’s not fair to us loyal customers. Do you even have documents from their MD with the reason they need to board before those who pay extra! They should have a MD excuse to get on early, these people were all in one group, knew everyone and traveled together. So can I use my BMI of 2 over normal as a reason to get on first in the front 5 rows? Or maybe my A1C level is slightly elevated or that I have to take Lipitor because my cholesterol is high. A passenger had to notify a flight attendant that someone sitting in an aisle seat wasn’t wearing his mask after she walked past him! Seriously? Something needs to done to those passengers who are lying about their need to board before those who pay extra for early bird seating. Medical need to board early should have to be presented at the gate before they board prior those loyal customers earned a companion pass prior to covid!

Forget every positive experience about the Old Southwest, and erase those high reviews. Those days are over, and it's the end of an era. They should change their name to Scrubwest airline, because there is a high percentage your flight this Fall is going to get scrubbed. It will either get canceled, or they will move it to a new time that is often impossible to meet. If you complain by email, they will offer you $150 on another flight. Southwest apparently thinks "buying out" customers will work, completely ignores the reality that many of us have only specific times to fly. Plus, that future flight will probably just be canceled too, so what's the point? The brand name has been destroyed. A web search with a timeline of August 2021 or September 2021 will confirm I'm not alone in this experience, and that it's now common to many Southwest fliers.
route: Corpus Christi to New Orleans via Houston

comment: Not Verified |  I will never be flying on Southwest again! They forgot to fuel the aircraft my first flight so that delayed me 2 hours which then made me miss my other flight, so instead of giving me the next closest flight. They give me the last flight out. Then when I got into that flight which they already messed all of my plans for the day because I was supposed to land @ 10 now I’m still at the airport all day, the flight I’m about to board has something wrong with the plane so I’m now delayed again, I have a hotel room booked which is pointless know because I won’t be there till 2 am. Overall worse experience flying in my life & I’ve been flying for years. Seats are terrible as well. Do not book this airline, front desk workers are terrible at their job as well!

My family and I had a flight booked for $949.90. The flight was scheduled to leave early Monday morning. We discovered it was cancelled around 3am Monday morning. We tried to schedule a different flight from Albany to Orlando but the next flight wasn’t until Wednesday, meaning we would miss 1/3rd of our prepaid Disney vacation. We called southwests customer service but there was a 2 hour wait. We ultimately booked a flight out of Hartford, CT to Orlando. This flight cost $2,844.90 nearly $2000 more than the initial flight. We had to have a family member drive us to Hartford to get the flight. While driving to Hartford we called the southwest customer service number back. I explained the situation and expected them to say they would quickly refund the $2,844.90. To my surprise the person told me I had two options. 1- she could only refund the $949.90 (the cost of the initial flight and I would have to pay the $2,844.90, meaning the vacation would cost me nearly $2000 more than I budgeted or 2- she could book the next flight from Albany to Orlando, two days later (causing my family to miss two days of our prepaid vacation). I asked if I could speak with a supervisor but she said she is a supervisor and she could not refund the $2,844.90. I told her I planned a vacation with my young family a long time ago and the plane having technical difficulties wasn’t my fault, and I had to have a family member take the day off work to drive me to Hartford. She said my only other option was to send a message to the customer service department which would be responded to within 10 days. I told her it was unacceptable, I have to spend time on my family vacation putting in the complaint and not knowing if I’m being charged an additional $2000! After about two weeks I got an email, after asking for a call, and was told I’m not getting refunded the additional charge. Vacation cost $2000 more than expected.

We booked a roundtrip flight From Colorado Springs to the Las Vegas. For the return flight, my wife and I were kicked off the flight and stranded in Vegas with no way to get home. The flight attendant (I wish I got her badge number) grabbed me by the arm and told me I was harassing the patrons which is 100% untrue. We got pulled aside as we were boarding because I was not wearing a mask, and the manger was called. After I spoke with a manger, I put the mask on and was one of the last ones to be able to board the flight. My wife asked the lady next to her if she would trade seats with me so we could sit next to each other. She told my wife, "no problem" even though I was in a middle seat, and as we were passing each other in the isle, I asked her again if she was sure she was ok with switching me seats, and that is when the flight attended grabbed me by the arm and said to get off the flight, and that I was being deboarded for "harassments". When I got out of the tunnel, I went to the manger and expressed my concern about my luggage that was under the plane, and at that point he said if I do not get away from him he would call the police and have me arrested. So there we were with no flight home.

Not Verified |  Worst experience ever. My wife and I were supposed to fly to Denver then LA. We were rerouted to a Dallas then El Paso. No big deal. During flight our mask came down to the end of our nose, mine once, hers once and we were told to keep our mask up.
